However, now, knowing that she is a little older and will not be able to go out to walk the streets, she is planning to do some work in her house and build rooms that she can rent out.  This is Rita's second loan with Kiva and she is hoping for your help in order to continue with her objectives.  She promises to make her repayments on time.  With the 1500 Nuevo Soles loan that she has applied for, Rita will invest in buying newspapers and buying wood for the work in her house and building small rooms to rent out.

loans.use: to buy newspapers, and wood for making rooms to rent out.

loans.name: Santa Ana Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 6 personas emprendedoras  y con mucha creatividad para los negocios. Así son los integrantes del grupo comunal “SANTA ANA”.  La Sra. Amanda de 56 años de edad  y madre de  7  hijos,  ella se dedica hace 3 años  a la venta de verduras (tubérculos)  en un pequeño mercado.  La Sra. Amanda  nos cuenta que ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus  verduras   y así  obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá   en compras más  productos  (zapallo, zanahoria, rabanito, papas etc. ) y  así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Amanda  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos con Kiva y Edaprospo por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Amanda  se le distingue por su casaca negra es la primera señora de la mano izquierda,  se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en: This is the "Santa Ana" group, made up of six enterprising people who are very creative when it comes to business.  Amanda is 56 years old and a mother to seven children.  For three years she has been making a living selling vegetables (potatoes) in a small market.  She tells us that her customers are loyal, thus she earns a profit to cover household costs.  In the future Amanda would like to have her own premises where she can sell her vegetables and so earn higher profits.  With this loan, Amanda will invest in buying more products (pumpkin, carrots, radish, potatoes, and more) and then will be able to prosper.  Amanda and all the other members of the group are grateful to Kiva and Edaprospo for this loan and for the trust that they are being given.  In the photo, Amanda is the first on the left, wearing a black jacket.  Amanda promises that she achieve all her proposed targets.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Deysi Osmari

texts.es:
Doña Doris es una mujer de 30 años de edad casada y madre de 3 hijos con un grado de educación primaria completa. Ella es agricultora hace muchos años ya que su familia por tradición practica dicha actividad pasando sus conocimiento de generación en generación y junto a su esposo se dedican al cultivo y siembra de café mismo que es comercializado en los alrededores de la zona donde ella habita con los diferentes compradores, intermediarios y en el mercado local. Ella aprendió dicha actividad en compañía de sus padres y hoy en día lo elabora en compaña de su pareja siendo los únicos 2 involucrados en todas las actividades que realizan en el campo ya que sus hijos son menores de edad y están muy pequeños.

Actualmente ella solicita un financiamiento para la compra de 10 QQ de fertilizante, 13 QQ de formula cafetalera y 12 QQ de urea y 10 QQ de nutricafe para dar mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos de café ya que con ello espera que su cosecha mejore y de excelentes resultados.

Sus metas para el futuro son ampliar sus tierras, sembrar una variedad de granos que ayuden al crecimiento de su negocio, a mejorar los ingresos para su familia y sobre todo a generar ingresos para darles a sus hijos una buena educación, y enviarlos a la universidad.
texts.en:
Doris is 30 years old, married, and a mother to three children.  She completed primary school and has now been a farmer for many years.  Traditionally her family has always worked in farming, passing their knowledge through the generations.  Alongside her husband, Doris makes a living growing coffee which she sells in the area surrounding where she lives.  Different buyers and intermediaries come to the local market to buy the coffee.  Doris learned this trade from her parents and she now does the work with her husband.  They are the only ones involved in doing this work in the field as their children are still very young.

Doris is currently applying for a loan in order to buy 1000 lbs of fertliser, 1300 lbs of products for growing coffee, 1200 lbs of urea, and 1000 lbs of nutrients for coffee crops.  These are all for maintaining and helping the coffee crops and, with these products, she hopes to have a better harvest and excellent results.

Doris' goals for the future are to expand her lands, and plant a variety of grains that will help her business to grow.  She wants to improve her income for the family and, above all, to earn an income to give her children a good education and send them to university.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama, born in 1965, is a retired man who is married and a father of four. One of his sons is in the military, while another is working for a private company. 


Salama has been selling foodstuffs for 10 years, having started his business at home and later opening his own mini market carrying additional products. His enterprise has been sufficiently profitable to help him cover his children's needs. 


Salama is now seeking to add more products to his store such as notebooks, films and general stationary products. To do so, he is requesting this loan.

loans.use: To buy notebooks, films and general stationary products

loans.name: Ilias

texts.en:
Ilyas is a student at the American University of Central Asia (AUCA) and here is his story:

My name is Ilyas. I graduated Kyrgyz-Turkish High School this year and enrolled the American University of Central Asia, because it is one of the best universities in Central Asia and particularly has a very good reputation in our country. I am sure that it will give me a very good opportunity after graduation and all other students who graduate from this university are definitely ready to raise our country to a new, industrial level of development. I have enough knowledge and desire to study at AUCA. I had high grades at school, and above-average results in admission exam. I also took part in the city Russian language Olympiad. 

It is difficult for my family to cover full tuition fees, which caused my application for a financial aid. It is very good opportunity that AUCA gives to its students. KIVA loan will make life easier to all the students that will get a financial support from them.
  
I am aware of AUCA students to be working in big companies of Kyrgyzstan, thereby recommending AUCA as one of the best universities. When I graduate AUCA I definitely find a prestigious job like those successful alumni and have a power to change our country. Now it is the key point in the development of our country, and we need someone who can skillfully manage the finances of Kyrgyzstan. I believe that the American University of Central Asia will give the most necessary knowledge and abilities to become a professional specialist. I will do my best to satisfy you with my achievements also.

loans.use: To pay for higher education.

loans.name: Hoshimjon

texts.ru: Хошимжон целеустремленный мужчина привыкший добиваться всего сам. Ему 43 года он из района Дж.Руми. Хошимжон женат и у него трое детей. Его дети – это его мотивация, ради них он живет и трудится. Он хочет начать животноводческий бизнес и разводить крупнорогатый скот, но начального капитала у него не хватает для осуществления цели. По этой причине он просит кредит. От их прибыли Хошимжон надеется построить дом, так как его старый уже разваливается. Учитывая климат Таджикистана, домам каждый год надо делать ремонт. Но на ремонт у Хошимжона нет денег. А его семье надо, где то жить. Он работает не покладая рук. Надеемся, что у него все получится.
texts.en:
Hoshimjon is a purposeful man accustomed to achieving everything on his own. He is 43 years old and from the region of J. Rumy. Hoshimjon is married and has three children. His children are his motivation, and it is because of them that he lives and works.  

He wants to start a business breeding cattle, but doesn't have enough start-up capital to implement his plan. For this reason, he has applied for a loan. From its profits, Hoshimjon hopes to build a house, since his old house is falling apart. Due to the climate in Tajikistan, he has needed to repair this house every year, but hasn't had the money for it. His family needs a place to live and he works tirelessly. We hope that he will succeed.

loans.use: to buy and resell cattle

loans.name: Abulfaz

texts.en:
Abulfaz is a 53-year-old man, married and the father of 3 kids. He runs a café and serves people with lunch and dinner. He has eight years of experience. He decided to start his own business because his income as a foreman was not stable and was very low. Now he runs his business and serves people with daily meals in his café. 

People in Azerbaijan like to have lunch in national style cafes and eat national food, as well as spend time with friends in the evening drinking tea with homemade jam. Abulfaz's place doesn’t look very attractive, but his food is delicious and that’s why his café is full of people. His older son helps him and cooks in his café. 

His monthly income is 200 AZN and he would like to increase it. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 2000 AZN. He will use this loan to renovate his café. This will be his fifth loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to renovate his café

loans.name: Sariyya

texts.en:
Sariyya is a 47-year-old married mother of 3 kids. For the past 18 years she has been raising sheep because mutton is in high demand in this region.  Sariyya's monthly income from this business is 150 AZN. This is a very profitable business and she is doing it together with her husband.
Sariyya is keeping a flock of sheep in her own yard. She fattens them and takes their meat to the central bazaar, where butchers and customers purchase from her. People use mutton for traditional dishes like kababs, dolmas, pilovs, etc.
She has taken a loan from Aqroinvest before and has a good loan history. This is going to be her third loan. This time she requires 2000 AZN to purchase 12 sheep in order to sell more meat in autumn. She is optimistic about this loan, because in autumn more people consume meat, due to the holidays and increased customers in restaurants.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sheep in order to sell more meat in autumn.

loans.name: Ilqar

texts.en:
Ilqar is 45 years old, married and father of three kids. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income for the family. For ten years he has grown fruits and vegetables in his yard and sold them in the bazaar. In this business his wife also helps him and from this business his monthly profit is 100 AZN.

In Azerbaijan, fruit is in very high demand and people like to eat fresh fruit a lot. Besides his fruit he also sells flowers. Ilqar is really optimistic about the future, regarding the expansion of his business, in order to raise the standard of living of his family.

For this, he has applied for a loan of 1,700 AZN. Ilqar has already taken a loan from Aqroinvest before. He is considered a good customer and this is his fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy new seeds

loans.name: Raqif

texts.en:
Raqif is a 33-year-old client who is married and has 2 kids. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his wife in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a Fuzulu refugee. He has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than 5 years. He is very hardworking and passionate about his work. He considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers and to plant fruit trees with his wife. He sells his crops in the central bazaar to make profits in order to support his family. Raqif’s income from his business is about 130 AZN. 

In order to improve the living conditions of his family, he plans to expand his business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. He believes that in the near future his sons will help him to grow the business. Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and fun, he wants the business to continue and prosper. He has applied to Aqroinvest for a loan. This loan is for the purpose of buying new fertilizer and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to obtain more revenue in the coming autumn, which will help him to cover his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik still pursues her various agricultural activities in the village of Achanan in the Syunik region. This year she has a good harvest for sale. She and her nice family do their best to have a good and tasty harvest for each season. Astghik’s son now also helps her in agriculture, since he has graduated from Yerevan State University and together they manage to cultivate vegetables, fruits and nuts. Astghik manages to sell the produce through the re-sellers. Simultaneously Astghik works for a government organization, focused on preserving the historical monuments of the Syunik province. Astghik’s husband is temporarily in the Russian Federation and from there he also financially helps his family.
She asks for a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams in order to buy seedlings, to organize sowing activities and to buy several chickens.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, to organize sowing activities and to buy several chickens which will allows her to receive a good profit from her agricultural business

loans.name: Salman

texts.en:
Salman, 49 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and daughters. He sells food products such as cakes, rice and sugar, among others. His store is set up in his house, which is on a corner with a great deal of traffic. That is where he very kindly tends to his customers. 


Salman started his business with his own capital 10 years ago to support his life partner with the household expenses.  Also, he feels like a productive and independent person with the enterprise. He wants to see his business grow, and he wishes to see that growth reflected in his family’s well-being.


Salman is grateful for the opportunity to access loans which he needs to continue meeting his goals. He is now requesting his fifth loan for 2000 AZN to buy food products such as cakes, rice, sugar and vegetables for his store. With a good loan history, he pledges to be a punctual and very responsible client.

loans.use: to buy food products such as cakes, rice, sugar and vegetables for his store.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a private enterpreneur from Armavir city, of Armavir region. She lives with her husband and son. Mariam runs a local shop where she sells clothes and shoes. The breadwinners of the family are Mariam and her son. In the present difficult social conditions, it is very difficult to cover the daily costs of the family; however, thanks to her hard work Mariam has been able to establish and run her small business.

She currently wants to maintain her business and increase the sales. To reach that goal, she needs to sell more products in her local shop. A loan of USD 2000 will be a huge support to Mariam and her family. The loan will help her to buy a new assortment of clothes and kids' shoes. This will make her small shop more competitive, and her business more sustainable. Mariam and her family will be grateful, to the lenders who will help to collect the needed amount for the loan.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of clothes and kids' shoes

loans.name: Manvel

texts.en:
Manvel is 56 years old. He lives in Kapan city with his wife and two children. Both his children are already married (daughter lives separately with her family). His son lives with him, along with his wife and small son. Manvel’s wife does not work, she is a house woman. For a long time Manvel works as a driver in Kapan city.  

As Manvel says his and his son’s salary together hardly cover their family needs, and after repairing  of their house, they have no money to buy some furniture for it.So he hopes to receive a Kiva lenders support in this case and  asks a loan of 900,000 Armenian drams to buy some furniture for their kitchen and guest room.

loans.use: to buy some furniture for their kitchen and guest room.

loans.name: Meruzhan

texts.en:
Meruzhan is 56 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city in Lori region. He is married and has a son who is in the Russian Federation and a daughter who is already married and lives separately with her family. His wife is unemployed and she is a housewife. 

Meruzhan for several years has worked as a driver-engineer, but at this moment he is a taxi driver. Of course his income is very low and he hardly manages to cover both the expanses of his family and car. He rents a car and already has many loyal customers. He has been engaged in this work for five years. 

Meruzhan is asking for a loan of 350,000 Armenian drams to buy a refrigerator and a washing machine for his house. Meruzhan’s wife most of all, will be very happy for these purchases.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and a washing machine for his house.

loans.name: Vusal

texts.en:
Vusal is a 28-year-old, married father of two little children. His wife is a housewife and stay-at-home mother caring for their children. They are expecting another baby soon. Vusal has been the owner of a small teahouse for six year. He usually works from 8:00 a.m. until 8:00 p.m. every day. He also has a taxi service for additional income. Vusal really enjoys his teahouse business. He likes to be around people and meeting new people. 
Vusal is requesting a loan so that he can purchase a table and chairs for his small teahouse. These purchases will help him to better meet the needs of the He hopes that the loan will help him increase his visitors thereby increasing his income and improving his living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase a table and chairs for a teahouse.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
This is Ana, age 28, from the seaside city on the Black Sea coast-Batumi. Ana is divorced and lives with her mother, sister, brother, retired grandmother and school-age son. Ana has higher education and works as an office manager at the private company, where she gets a modest monthly wage. Ana’s mother and sisters are employed as well. The mother is a masseuse and the sister works as a laboratory assistant at the local clinic. They also get monthly salaries. Ana’s brother and son are secondary school attendants.

Ana is a very energetic and brave woman, with a great desire to get ahead and give her son the proper education for progressing in life. Ana’s wage is not enough for making savings and covering food costs and utilities as well. That is why she has decided to start a clothing store. Batumi is a fast-growing city and it’s an attractive place to start a business. With the loan, she will conduct the store hiring, buy apparels and, after the store is well-stocked, Ana will be able to attract many customers. She will increase the turnover gradually and invest the profits in the same business. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to start up a clothing store

loans.name: Ghasan

texts.en: Ghasan was born in 1975. He is married and the father of 2. Ghasan has been selling foodstuffs and detergents for 4 months. He found his project profitable and he is planning to expand it by adding new products like mobile credit cards to sell them in order to raise his profit and better support his family. To do so, he applied for this loan, as he doesn't have enough money to buy them.

loans.use: to buy mobile credit cards.

loans.name: Las Radiantes Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por  6 personas   responsables a distintas actividades comerciales  todos ellos  residen en el distrito del Villa María Del Triunfo. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “LAS RADIANTES” una de ellas es mery de 69  Años de edad soltera y sin hijos, mery se dedica hace  40  años al servicio de costura remalle, tejidos macramé,  en un pequeño local (alquilado) con el fin de progresar día a día y salir adelante, mery  a sabido ganarse a los clientes  y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida. Mery  solicito el préstamo para comprar telas, hilos,lanas, ah  la vez  mery  y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos  con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado  y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. Mery  está parada y se le distingue con una chompa de color negro,  Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
The communal bank "LAS RADIANTES" is made up of 6 responsible people who work in different businesses and all live in the Villa María Del Triunfo district. One of the members is Mery who is 69 years old and is single with no children. For 40 years she has worked in clothing repairs, knitting and macrame in a small rented premises, with the aim of getting by day by day and making progress in life. Mery has learnt how to win customers and so has been able to improve her quality of life.

Mery is asking for the loan to buy fabric, thread and wool. She and all of the members are grateful to Kiva for the loan provided and for the confidence that has been shown in them. 

Mery is standing, wearing a black jumper. She signs off with the promise that she will meet all of her projected payments.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread and wool.

loans.name: Maripe

texts.en:
Maripe is a 52-year-old married father of five children between 9 and 21 years of age. For the past eight years he has been farming wheat on his own piece of land.  Because of the area's climatic conditions and fertile soil, wheat has proven to do very well, and the market is readily available for both retail and wholesale buyers.


Maripe, who learned about KADET from women who were already members, is now requesting his fourth loan of kes 120,000, having repaid his previous ones. He will use the money to prepare his land and buy seedlings and fertilizer for his wheat farm. 


Maripe hopes to use the profit arising from this loan to expand his farming activity from small-scale to commercial farming. He is a self-motivated man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Doña Marisol ha luchado mucho para poder culminar su meta que es construir su casa, en los creditos anteriores a relaizado mejorar en la vivienda, pero ya sus hijos van creciendo ella piensa realizar un aumento para tener mejores condiciones y mas espacion en su casa, ya parte del aranque del anexo esta relaizado pero necesita comprar Bloques, Cemento,Hierro, Perlines, etc para culminarlo. Agradece el apoyo que Afodenic en conjunto a Fondos Kiva le estan brindado.
texts.en:
Marisol has worked very hard to reach her goal of building her own home. With her previous loans she was able to make improvements to her home, but now that her children are growing up she would like to build an addition to improve her family’s living conditions and to have more space. Marisol says that part of the addition has already been built but that she needs to buy cinder blocks, cement, iron bars, purlins, and other materials to finish it.

Marisol is thankful to Kiva lenders and the field partner for their support.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish an addition to her home.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en: Imelda is a married woman from Bohol. She has two children, aged one and three years old. Her husband goes fishing and Imelda sells whatever he catches. She sells fresh fish in the neighborhood for a living. She has been selling fish for the past five years. She has requested a loan of 14000 PHP to buy nylon, fish net and lead. In the future, Imelda would like to expand her fishing business to increase business profitability. Her income will be for her children's healthy diet as well as reinvestment into the same business.

loans.use: to buy nylon, fish net and lead

loans.name: Gonzalo De Jesús

texts.es: Gonzalo, a sus 63 años de edad, es separado y padre de 7 hijos. Hace aproximadamente 2 años, se dedica a atender su pequeño negocio una chaza ambulante donde vende mecato, confitería, café, jugos, minutos a celular, entre otros, con lo que ha generado ingresos para el sustento de su familia. Trabaja diariamente desde las 4:00 am hasta las 3:00 pm, lo que le ha permitido ser reconocido en sector y le ha permitido obtener buenos resultados, pues se encuentra ubicado en una calle muy concurrida de la ciudad donde reside. El cliente manifiesta que su edad no es impedimento para seguir trabajando, pues le gusta sentirse útil y conseguir el sustento diario por cuenta propia. Esto lo lleva a solicitar un segundo ciclo crediticio, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (mecato, confitería, galleterìa, café, entre otros) con esto podrá seguir con su negocio, satisfaciendo las necesidades y gustos de los clientes y mejorando así, su nivel de ingresos diarios, con los cuales espera seguir fortaleciendo su negocio para que le garantice una estabilidad económica y, en un futuro cercano poder disfrutar los frutos de su ardua labor.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is 63 years old and is separated with 7 children. For about 2 years he has had a small business running a mobile stall where he sells cakes, sweets, coffee, juices, mobile phone credit and other items and by doing this he has generated an income to support his family. He works every day from 4am to 3pm, which has made him well known in his area and has enabled him to get good results, since he is situated in a very busy street of the city where he lives.

Gonzalo says his age is no hindrance to carrying on working, since he likes to feel useful and to be able to provide the daily necessities himself. This leads him to ask for a second loan, with the aim of buying stock wholesale (cakes, sweets, biscuits, coffee and other items). With this he will be able to continue with his business, satisfying his customers' needs and preferences and thus improving his daily income. He hopes to continue building up his business so that it guarantees him economic stability and in the near future he hopes to be able to enjoy the fruits of all his hard work.

loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (cakes, sweets, biscuits, coffee and other items)

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en: Anastasia, a 38-year-old married mother of four from Embu, has a business as a dairy farmer. Her children are aged 18, 16, 9 and 6 years respectively. She also sells second hand clothes to supplement her income. Anastasia earns a monthly income of KES 18,000 which she uses to support her family. This marks her first loan term with KADET after she was introduced by an existing KADET client. With the loan she has applied from KADET LTD, Anastasia will be able to purchase another dairy cow. Additional income created will allow her improve the standard of living for her family, educate her children and reinvest the remaining amount in her business. In the future, Anastasia would like to buy more dairy cows to increase the production of milk for supply to her clients. She hopes to save money for educating her children to the university level.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock wholesale (sweets, pastries, cookies, coffee)

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en: Eleuteri is a married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five children aged between 16 and 29 years old. She is engaged in the pottery making business. She has been making and selling pots made of clay for 10 years now, while her husband works as a carpenter. She has requested a loan of 9000 PHP to buy clay and a new mould. This in turn will help her to be more productive in her business. Any profit generated will be for her family's daily consumption, school fees and savings. In the future, she hopes to be able to save so she can live in comfort in her old age.

loans.use: to buy clay and new mold

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en: Natividad, 60, is married and blessed with nine children. She sells fruits, especially bananas, and has been working in her business for almost four years. In this business, she earns a net income of 2,000 PHP a week. Due to a lack of capital, she would like to avail herself of a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase bananas to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can earn more income to improve more her business.

loans.use: to purchase bananas to sell.

loans.name: Asima

texts.en:
Asima is a 33-years-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has requested a loan for her husband’s fruits selling business. Her husband owns a fruits selling business in a nearby fruits market. With the increase in the household expenses, she wants to grow their business.
Therefore, she has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband will be able to buy fresh fruits and equilibrium to measure the weight. 
Asima is the mother of 6 children. Her children are students and none of them are able to get any income, and thus are fully dependent upon their father. She wants to save the profits so that she will be able to face any sudden incidents or medical treatment for her children. Asima hopes that this loan will prove productive for her and she will save a reasonable amount soon. Asima is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits and equilibrium to measure the weight

loans.name: Palmerinda Group

texts.es:
Doña Felicitas es una mujer de 51 años,  solo estudio la primaria y es viuda, ella vive en una 
pequeña comunidad llamada Palmerinda en la cual las principales fuentes de trabajo son el cultivo de caña de azúcar y la ganadería, ella es una de las integrantes de un grupo que lleva el nombre de la comunidad para que fuera mas fácil de ubicarlos.  

Doña Felicitas platica que hace mas de 16 años puso una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su hogar con el objetivo de crear su propia fuente de empleo para brindar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, ella comenta que al pasar de los años su tienda ha ganado un mejor surtido inicio metiendo un poco de papelería y después cosméticos, ella piensa que entre mas productos ofrece a sus clientes mejor le va en sus ventas y ganancias. 
ella a solicitado un crédito a vision fund para invertirlo en la compra de arroz, frijol, aceite, harinas, sopa, productos enlatados, dulces, refrescos, cuadernos, lapices, lapiceros, sacapuntas, borradores, plumones, labiales, lociones, esmaltes, cremas y perfumes para continuar con sus ventas. 

ella espera que su negocio continué creciendo ya que le gustaría hacer algunas remo delaciones a su hogar. 
los demas integrantes del grupo son:
Eva Jade servicio de sastreria
Adriana venta de comida y calzado
Darwing venta de carne 
Felipa  venta de comida
texts.en:
Felicitas is 51 years old and is a widow with just primary education. She lives in a small community called Palmerinda where the main sources of work are growing sugar cane and rearing livestock. She is a member of a group which has taken the name of their community so it is easy to locate them.

Felicitas says that more than 16 years ago she set up a small grocery store in her home with the intention of creating her own source of work so she could give her family a better quality of life. She says that as the years have gone by her shop stock has improved, beginning with a small amount of stationery and later cosmetics. She thinks that the more products she offers her customers, the better the sales and profits she gets.

Felicitas is asking VisionFund for a loan to buy rice, beans, oil, flour, soup, tinned goods, sweets, drinks, notebooks, pencils, pens, pencil sharpeners, erasers, felt tip pens, lotions, nail varnish, creams and perfumes. She hopes her business will continue to grow as she would like to carry out some improvements to her home.

The other members of the group are: Eva Jade (tailoring services), Adriana (food and footwear sales), Darwing (meat sales) and Felipa (food sales).

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, flour, soup, tinned goods, sweets, drinks, notebooks, pencils, pens, pencil sharpeners, erasers, felt tip pens, lotions, nail varnish, creams and perfumes.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 50 años, está casada con Jorge con quien tiene 3 hijos que ya son mayores, tiene una casa propia que la comparte con dos de sus hijas, dos nietos y su esposo. El trabajo de Sonia consiste en la venta de ropas, zapatos y lencería, realiza esta función vendiendo a crédito entre sus amigas, vecinas y familiares a quienes cobra de manera semanal o mensual. Por lo general todos los productos que vende son solicitados por pedidos específicos de sus clientes. Lleva en este trabajo más de 22 años, le va bien hasta ahora y tiene la ayuda de su pareja y sus dos hijas. Cuando se inició en este negocio estaba llena de dudas e inseguridades, sin embargo poco a poco fue aprendiendo y ahora se volvió una excelente comerciante. Le gusta su trabajo porque puede generar su propia fuente de ingresos económicos y porque además comparte esta actividad junto a su cónyuge, del mismo modo tiene el tiempo necesario para cumplir con sus funciones de ama de casa, tiene muchos planes a futuro entre ellos desea establecer un local donde pueda exhibir adecuadamente todo lo que ofrece a la venta y atender de manera mas cómoda a sus clientes. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, por tanto agradece a todos los que hacen posible su crédito para continuar con sus objetivos, ella por su parte se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado comprará ropa, sandalias y lencería femenina de diversos diseños y de gran calidad.
texts.en: Sonia, 50, is married to Jorge, with whom she has three adult children. She has her own house that she shares with two of her daughters, two grandchildren, and her husband. Sonia sells clothing, shoes, and lingerie. She does this by selling to friends, neighbors and family members on credit, and she collects from them weekly or monthly. Generally, all the products that she sells are requested through specific orders by her customers. She has been in this business for more than 22 years. It has gone well so far and she has the help of her husband and two daughters. When she started this business, she was full of doubts and insecurities. However, little by little she learned and today she has become an excellent businesswoman. She likes her work because she can create her own source of income and because she also shares this activity with her spouse. She also has enough time to do her work as the lady of the house. She has lots of plans for the future. Among them, she wants to set up a store where she can suitably show off everything that she sells and more comfortably attend to her customers. On this occasion, she will ask for 2,000 soles. She is grateful to all of those who make her loan possible in order to continue with her goals. For her part, she promises to make her payments on time. With the amount she has asked for, she will buy clothing, sandals, and assorted styles of quality women's lingerie.

loans.use: to buy clothing, sandals, and women's lingerie.

loans.name: Sumarni

texts.en:
The story of Sigit, son of Sumarni:

My favourite subject is computer and networking. My reason to choose this vocational study is I want to be a computer expert, specifically, a programer. My problem is about finance. It is hard for my parents to pay the school fee because they are poor. Besides that, my hometown is very far from school and the public transportation vehicles are still rare. My new friends and teachers here are friendly and nice to me. This condition makes me feel comfort.

As for my extra activity, I joined the football club at school. 

The financial condition of my family is not good. My parents are only poor farmers. Their money is not sufficient to fulfill the family's daily necessities, moreover my school fee.  We stay at a very unpretentious house. All the walls are made from bamboo, and the floor is still soil (no stone, no brick and not coated with cement). Actually, it is not proper to be lived in, but we have no other choice.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Sunarjo

texts.en:
The story of Susan, daughter of Sunarjo:

My favourite subject is computer and networking because I learn many things about them. I know the technology advancement and development in the computer world. I am a new student in the first semester. So far, so good. I can follow the lesson well. 

What we have is an unpretentious house. I have been living at this house for 16 years since I was born. With the loan given to me, I can pay my school fee and I can continue my study. Higher level of education may give me a chance to reach my dream easier. 

I live in Jeruklegi subdistrict. It is neither lonely nor crowded, just a little town. The occupation of my parents is farmers. They are not the owners of the farm field but only laborers. Their salary per month is about Rp 200,000. It’s very low and not enough to fulfill our daily necessities, moreover my school fee. The number of children in my family is five. Most of them are married and it's only me who is at school.

The Kiva loan can lighten the financial burden of my parents, specifically for my school fee. I choose computer and networking because I am interested in computer. Computer is connected to the world and human life. Besides that, I want to be a computer expert. The fun thing at school is I have new things and meet new friends. Maybe the hard thing is when I meet a new and difficult lesson in computer and networking, but I encourage myself to study harder. 

After graduation I’d like to work in a company as a computer administrator/technician or computer programmer. I want to be a successful person.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Rosmini

texts.en:
The story of Sariman, son of Rosmini:

My favourite subject is computer and networking. My reason to choose this vocational study is I want to be a computer expert, especially a programer. The hardest part for me is the way from hometown to school, because the road is broken and difficult to pass on it. I am pleased because most of the teachers are good and friendly. At this school I joined the student football team. I like play football very much. Having many new friends is something fun for me.
 
The condition of my family is poor. Truly, I am apprehensive about my future and the continuity of my study. My hometown is Menganti village, in Cilacap regency. We stay at a very unpretentious house. All the walls are made from bamboo, and the floor is still soil (no stone, no brick and not coated with cement). Actually it is not proper to be lived in, but we have no other choice. 

The financial condition of my family is not good. My parents are only poor farmers. Their salary per month is around Rp 500,000. Their money is not sufficient to fulfill the family daily necessities, moreover my school fee. The number of children in my family is three. They are 13 years old (at junior high school), 16 years old (me/vocational high school) and 25 years old (married).

I’d like to thank to Kiva lenders who are willing to lend me funds. The Kiva loan can lighten the financial burden of my parents. Specifically for my school fee.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Alexander Fredy

texts.es: Alexander  de 32 años de edad,  soltero y sin hijos, es una agradable estudiante de la facultad de ingeniería ambiental y recursos naturales,   que estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Alexander tiene la meta de culminar sus estudios con éxitos y poder ser un buen ingeniero. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  para el pago de sus pensiones universitarias  y  realizar la compra  de útiles de estudio que necesita. Alexander    se encuentra muy agradecido  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con muchos deseos de culminar sus metas propuestas agradece a  kiva por la oportunidad brindada.
texts.en: Alexander, 32, is single and has no children. He is a nice person and a student at the Faculty of Environmental Engineering and Natural Resources. He studies hard in order to reach his goals. Alexander’s goal is to finish his studies in order to become an engineer. With this loan, he will pay for the tuition fee and buy some supplies he needs for his studies. Alexander deeply appreciates the help he received and says that he feels enthusiastic about reaching the goals he has set. He wants to thank KIVA for this opportunity.

loans.use: to pay for his university.

loans.name: Turisah

texts.en:
The story of Tri, daughter of Turisah:

My major is in accounting. With this knowledge and skill, I am sure that I can get a job. Making a new adaptation was a little hard for me. But it happened quickly because my friends are nice and also my teachers. I am happy to have many friends. Something fun in school for me is accounting lessons, but the hard thing is sport lessons. 

I would like to thank Kiva lenders because of your help. With it, I can continue my study. With a good level of study I am sure that I can reach my dream.

My hometown is Brebeg village, Jeruklegi subdistrict, Cilacap Regency, Mid Java Province, Indonesia. The roads around my village are bad, with many holes, muddy and rocky. It’s difficult to pass by. My parents are poor farmers and their salary is low. It’s around Rp. 300,000 per month. The number of children in my family is three. They are Siti Mariah (24 years old), Pujiati (20 years old), me (14 years old). Only I am at school. This fund can improve the life of my family. It means that I can continue my study.

I will study about accounting for three years in this school (until graduated). I want to be a good accountant in my future. I also want to see my parents happy.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.en:
Teofilo is married, with four children. This borrower is from the village of Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Years ago, he decided to move to town and eventually established his own business where he works with his employee. The borrower starts work in the early morning. In the future, he would like to have a business expansion, so he can work with his family.

Now, the borrower needs a loan, so that he can buy more charcoal and copra for his business.

loans.use: buy more charcoal and copra.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 29 years old and married to Tiwa. They are blessed with four children. She has been in the construction business for the last four years with the monthly income of KES 20,000.

She is applying for her first loan with KADET Ltd. of KES 20,000, which she plans to use to expand her place of work. The anticipated profit will be used to buy a plot. Her hope is to be a successful woman.

loans.use: To expand her place of work.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a business lady selling cereals in Mombasa. She has been selling cereals for the past three years and her business has been gradually growing.

This marks her third loan term with KADET to finance her business. Priscilla is diversifying her business and wants to start offering typing services as well. She plans to purchase a desktop computer with this new loan. She will continue to use the anticipated profits to educate her children as well as to repay her loan. She hopes to see all of her children well educated and comfortable and also to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase a desktop computer.

loans.name: Tanzeela

texts.en:
Tanzeela  is 36 years old and lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband has been running a small general store for many years, and he knows about the needs and the demand of the people. Most of his customers tell him that he should offer vegetables also because all the vegetable shops are very far away from the town. 

Responding to the needs and the demand of his customers, he wants to buy vegetables also, but he does not have sufficient money to buy them.   In this way he could easily fulfill the demand and earn more profit than earlier. 

Therefore, Tanzeela has requested a loan for her husband so that he will be able to buy vegetables to sell. 

Tanzeela says thank you to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To add vegetables to what her husband sells at his general store

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Kuña Pyapy Mbarete es un nuevo grupo, está en el nivel uno con las esperanzas puestas en el programa de comité, esperanzadas de que le será de mucha ayuda para poder mejorar los ingresos y la vida de cada una de ellas.
La Sra. Alice es la presidenta del grupo, ella es docente y desea realizar trabajos de manualidades, es madre de 2 jóvenes estudiantes universitarios, separada, se esfuerza al máximo para llegar a ser una mujer exitosa y lo está consiguiendo a través del trabajo continuo. Trabaja en forma disciplinada incentiva a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza y sacar adelante sus familias.
La Sra. Invertirá este crédito en una nueva actividad que es el rubro de las manualidades, y quiere poder comprar telas, hilos, pinturas y demás, y agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
“Kuña Pyapy Mbarete” is a new group that is at Level 1 of the committee program.  The members hope the program will be very helpful as they seek to improve their incomes and their individual lives.

Sra. Alice is the group president.  She is a teacher and wants to make handcrafted items.  Alice is the mother of two young university students.  She is separated from her spouse and strives to do her best to become a successful woman.  Alice plans to achieve this goal by working continuously.  By working in a disciplined manner, she motivates other women to strive to overcome poverty and help their families move forward.  

Alice will invest her loan in a new business in the handicraft trade.  She wants to buy fabrics, thread, paints, and other supplies.  Alice is grateful for the opportunity she has received.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, thread, paints, and other supplies for her new handicraft business.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is still in the charcoal business in Utange, Mombasa. She has been selling charcoal to the residents of Utange, a business she has done for the past six years and declares it is doing great.

This is her sixth borrowing from KADET Ltd. to finance her business. She plans to purchase more sacks of charcoal with the loan. 

Rehema has been using the proceeds to educate her children and to repay back her loan. She hopes to have a more profitable and expanded business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a second-hand clothing dealer in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. She is a married mother of three, whose husband earns additional income. Her husband is an electrician in Mombasa. She has been in her business for seven years and she has done very well.

This is Beatrice's third loan with Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET). Her previous loans have been successfully paid and she will use this loan to purchase more bales of second-hand clothes to sell. The anticipated profit will be used to further expand her business. 

She hopes to open more stores and to be fully self-employed.

loans.use: to purchase bales of second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
Armida is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a furniture-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional equipment for her furniture-making business.

Armida successfully paid back her previous loan, and she is now requesting a new loan in order to build her business.

NWTF is re-listing Armida's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for making furniture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Ari

texts.en:
The story of Defri, son of Ari:

I like entrepreneurship lessons. With them, I know about the entrepreneurial world and how to build a business. Besides that, I am also eager to learn computer knowledge. I want to know everything about computers.

My village is Tritih Wetan, Jeruklegi subdistrict, Cilacap Regency, Mid Java Province. The hard thing for me is the far distance between my hometown and school. Moreover the transportation vehicles are still rare. 

Thank you, Kiva. With the loan given to me from Kiva, I can continue my study. Formerly, I almost dropped out and gave up because my parents cannot pay the school fee. 

The condition of my house is unpretentious and almost broken. There are many holes in the roof, so when the rain comes, you can see many waterfalls in my house. My father is a laborer and his salary is around Rp. 500,000 a month. The number of children is two. They are my younger sister (13 years old), and me (15 years old). We are students. This loan can improve the financial condition of my family. After graduation, I want to be a computer technician. I want to repair many computers.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Arenas De Villa Group

texts.es: Un grupo conformado por 6  mujeres  responsables a distintas actividades comerciales. Así son las integrantes del grupo comunal. “ARENAS DE VILLA ” una de ellas es  Teodora  de 55 años soltera y sin   hijos, la Sra. Teodora  se dedica ya hace 10 años ah la confección de ropa tanto para caballeros como para damas  en un pequeño local (alquilado)  todos los días con el merito de salir adelante, Teodora  ha logrado mejorar su economía  y mejorar su calidad de vida , y  así Seguir mejorando su negocio  , Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá  en comprar telas para poder seguir confeccionado ropa  y así poder tener más ingresos. A la vez se despide con un abraso a Kiva y Edaprospo,  Teodora es la primera de la mano derecha se le distingue con un chaleco negro,  agradece el crédito brindado ya que hace posible su progreso.
texts.en: A group made up of six women responsible for different business activities. These are the members of the Arenas de Villa communal bank. Teodora is one of them. She is 55 years old and has no children. For ten years now, Teodora has worked every day making clothing for men as well as women in a small, rented establishment, all with the goal of moving forward. She has been able to improve her finances and her quality of life, and this way keep improving her business. With the loan provided, she will buy fabric to be able to continue making clothing and that way have more income. She signs off  with a hug to Kiva and Edaprospo. Teodora is the first person on the right. She is wearing a black vest. She is thankful for the loan given, since it makes her progress possible.

loans.use: to buy fabrics.

loans.name: Steffanie

texts.es: Steffanie, de 24 años, es soltera y aún no es madre,  vive en la casa de sus padres con su sobrino y su hermana. El trabajo de Steffanie consiste en la venta de ropa como polos, pantalones, blusas y camisas. Vende sus productos entres los amigos de su barrio, familiares y compañeros de trabajo, ofrece artículos de marcas reconocidas, con diseños innovadores pero sobre todo de muy buena calidad, a precios cómodos, además brinda las mejores facilidades de pago. Lleva en este trabajo cerca de 4 años y lo realiza con el apoyo de su madre y de su hermana. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es su independencia ya que le permite tener tiempo y espacio suficiente para desarrollar otra actividad laboral en un conocido local de venta de combustibles de la ciudad y lo hace sin descuidar su negocio. En esta oportunidad solicitará S/. 2000, se siente contenta de saber que le brindan el acceso a una línea de crédito para avanzar con su negocio. Por eso se compromete a ser responsable con el pago de sus cuotas para continuar en el futuro.Con el monto solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir como blusas, pantalones, camisas, polos y bermudas en diversos diseños.
texts.en:
24-year-old Steffanie is single and is not a mother yet. She lives in her parents' house with her nephew and her sister. Steffanie's work consists of selling clothing such as polo shirts, trousers, blouses and shirts. She sells her clothing to friends in the neighbourhood, family members and work colleagues. She sells well-known brands with innovative designs but always of a very high quality, at good prices and with the best payment terms. She has been doing this for 4 years with the help of her mother and her sister. What she likes about the work is her independence, since it gives her enough time and freedom to carry out another job at a well known fuel supplier in the city and she is able to do this without neglecting her business.

On this occasion Steffanie is asking for a loan of 2000 soles and feels happy that she is being given access to a credit facility so she can continue with her business. For this reason she promises to be responsible in paying her instalments so she can carry on doing this in the future. She will use the loan sum to buy a large quantity of clothing items such as blouses, trousers, shirts, polo shirts and shorts in various designs.

loans.use: to buy clothing wholesale.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 50 years old and married with two children.

Ana Marie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items like rice, soft drinks, and other beverages.

Ana Marie has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years, and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Ana Marie aspires to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items like rice, soft drinks, and other beverages.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 57 years old, married, and supports a family of ten members. He and his wife are blessed with four children between the ages of 12 and 23; they are all school-going. His main source of income comes from his carpentry business, and also from the retail shop that his wife runs.

John has borrowed a third loan of KES 110,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this to purchase timber to make more furniture to sell, and also purchase additional stock for his retail business.  The profits he earns will be used to repay the loan and also pay school fees for his children.

His dreams are to live in prosperity and enjoy happiness.

loans.use: To purchase timber and also stock his retail shop.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 37-year-old single mother of one from Mwingi.  She earns a living for her family by operating a small retail shop. 

She has been unable to keep her shop fully stocked due to lack of investment capital. Her business is only marginally sustainable because she is unable to expand it. Her goal is to fully stock her store in order to attract more customers and increase her profits. 

Grace is requesting for a loan from KADET LTD in order to stock her shop with rice, sugar, maize meal, cooking oil, and flour. With the additional income she will earn from this improvement, she will reinvest into her business. 

In the future, Grace plans to continue to invest in her business and to eventually operate a larger wholesale store.

loans.use: to stock her shop with rice, sugar, maize meal, cooking oil, and flour

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 52 years old and married, with three children. Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

Gina has been in this business for 30 years and sells a variety of items, such as soap, soft drinks, canned goods, curls, etc. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her grandson to school.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Felicite

texts.en:
Felicite is a Cameroonian and she is aged 45 and married with seven children. The oldest child is 27 years old and is in the university and the youngest is nine and in secondary school. 

She has been in this business for the past three years, which makes her very experienced and stable. Her business is successful because it is located in an urban area where the need is high. She is likely to succeed because of her experience in the business and the back to school period which makes the demand very high. This loan will help her increase her profit by 20 percent as well as increase her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy material to sew school uniforms

loans.name: Shakeela's Group

texts.en:
Shakeela is 46 years old, and she is the mother of four daughters and a son. 

Her whole family is involved in manufacturing bottles through a compression molding machine. Her son and husband operate the molding machine and her daughters are responsible for finishing the manufactured bottles. In this way, all of her family members are doing efforts to contribute to their monthly income. After manufacturing the bottle, her husband sells it to the market. 

The compression molding machine became out of order due to excess heating and needs to be fixed. Due to a problem with the molding machine, some of the family members have to sit idle and are without income as well. 

Therefore, Shakeela requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she could fix the molding machine. 

She wants to make savings to collect the dowry for the marriages of her daughters.

Shakeela seems very happy and relaxed after taking this loan and says thanks to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy plastic raw material for manufacturing bottles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish, fruits, and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, a 40-year-old business lady who is married to Sakayo, lives in Mwingi and earns a living for her family by operating a retail shop. She has been unable to keep her shop fully stocked due to lack of investment capital. 

Her business is only marginally sustainable because she is unable to expand it. Her goal is to fully stock her store in order to attract more customers and increase her profits. Beatrice is requesting for a loan from KADET LTD in order to stock her shop with rice, sugar, maize meal, cooking oil, and flour. With the additional income, she will earn from this improvement which she will reinvest into the business. 

In the future, Beatrice plans to venture into the carpentry business.

loans.use: to stock her shop with rice, sugar, maize meal, cooking oil, and flour

loans.name: Jasmine

texts.en:
Jasmine is 45 years old and married, with four children.

Jasmine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and she has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) in order to purchase additional goods to sell in her store.

Jasmine has been in this business for nine years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana, a 36-year-old, married mother of two in Mwingi, earns a living for her family by selling second-hand clothes. Juliana also sells fruit to supplement her income. 

Due to limited income to fund her business, she has been unable to expand her business. That is why she decided to request for a loan from Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) to enable her to purchase more bales of clothes, thus expanding her customer base which, in turn, will increase her sales and increase her profits too. 

With the additional income she will earn from this improvement, Juliana will save for her children’s education and repay her loan. In the future, Juliana would like to start a cereals business and she wishes to purchase a piece of land for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул 46 лет. Совместно с супругом Болотбеком растят двоих детей. В 2003 году, супруги начали бизнес в торговле мукой, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 10,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Айнагул имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, супруги смогли купить скот. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Айнагул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) для оптовой покупки муки, для дальнейшей розничной продажи населению. Доходы от кредита Айнагул планирует вложить в увеличение товарооборота и накопить деньги на обучение в университете для своих детей.
texts.en: Ainagul is 46 years old.  She is rasing two children together with her husband.  The spouses started their own business in selling flour in 2003, using a starting capital of 10,000 som (KGS).  Having developed her business and obtained regular customers, Ainagul now has an average monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to their hard work in this business, the spouses were able to buy livestock.  In order to further grow and expand her business, Ainagul requested a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy flour wholesale for subsequent retail sale to residents.  Ainagul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into increasing her product turnover and saving money for educating her children in a university.

loans.use: to buy flour wholesale

loans.name: Syrga

texts.ru: Сырге 54 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Сырги - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Сырга занимается животноводством, стартовав 23 года назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Сырги, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 10 дойных коров. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS)от продажи молока. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сырга обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Сырга планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины
texts.en: Syrga is 54 years old, married and raising five children together with her husband. Syrga has a secondary education. To provide the primary source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 23 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Syrga's hard work, today her business contains 10 dairy cows. The monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS) from sales of milk. In order to further develop her business, Syrga requested a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy calves for subsequent resale at a market at a high price. Syrga plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy calves for subsequent resale

loans.name: Suyundic

texts.ru: Суюндик женат и у него двое детей. Ему 48 лет. Он работает автомехаником в районе Дж.Руми. Район Дж.Руми маленький район и работать автомехаником не эффективно, так как машин там очень мало. Суюндик является активным клиентов Хумо. В первый раз он получил кредит для растениеводства. Жители района не могут заниматься одним делом. Они очень трудолюбивы и ответственные люди. Суюндик посеял овощи для потребления, для своей семьи. Получил хороший урожай, часть урожая продал в оптом одному торговцу. Его жизнь налаживается. Он пережил много невзгод. В этот раз Суюндик берет кредит для открытия своего нового бизнеса, животноводства. Этот вид деятельности является прибыльным и Суюндик решительно намерен заняться именно этим видом деятельности. Он сможет совмещать работу по специальности (работать автомехаником), заняться растениеводством и животноводством. Вот начать этот бизнес ему тяжело без финансовой поддержки и помощи. Так как не каждый может начать и продолжит этот вид бизнеса. Он верит в свой успех и надеется на вашу доброту. На вырученные деньги Суюндик сможет развить свой бизнес и собрать денег на образование своих детей.
texts.en: Suyundic is married and has two children. He is 48 years old. He works as a car mechanic in the J. Rumi region. This is a small region, and working as a car mechanic is not very profitable as there are few cars there. Suyundic is  a current client of Humo. At first, he obtained a loan for growing produce. In his region, it is not possible for the locals to only have  a single source of income. They are very hard-working and responsible. Suyundic has planted vegetables to be consumed by his own family. He had a good harvest and sol part of it wholesale to a reseller. His life is picking up gradually. He has had to face many hardships. This time Suyundic is taking out a loan to launch a new business in raising livestock. This is a profitable business, and Suyundic has a firm intention to go into this business. He will be able to combine work in his profession (as a car mechanic) with growing farm produce and raising livestock. However, it is difficult for him to launch this business without financial help and support. Not everyone is capable of launching and developing this type of business. He believes in his success and hopes for your kindness. Suyundic will use his revenues to develop his business and save money for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to launch a new business successfully.

loans.name: Kuña Rory 2 Group

texts.es:
Kuña Rory 2 está en su primer ciclo, es un grupo con gran expectativa de poder crecer, ellas quieren capacitarse y poder ayudar de esa forma a sus familias. Ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, y de esa forma poder conocer la situación de cada una.
Una persona digna de contar es la Sra. Rumilda, quien con su trabajo y esfuerzo está mejorando su situación de pobreza, ella es consciente que la única forma de crecer es por medio del trabajo. Tiene una despensa, que con mucho sacrificio pudo montar, y que hoy en día ya ha crecido bastante y con lo cual ayuda a su familia. Hoy pide de este crédito ya que quiere surtir su despensa con verduras, frutas, carne, enlatados y demás, y así seguir ofreciendo una buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
“Kuña Rory 2” is in its first loan cycle.  This group has great expectations of being able to grow.  The members want to receive training so that they will be able to help their families.  They have taken a poverty elimination survey so that each member can become familiar with her situation.  

One person whose story is worth telling is Sra. Rumilda.  She works and strives to improve her poverty situation.  Rumilda is aware that the only way to grow is through work.  She has a food pantry that she established with great sacrifice.  Today her business is growing and she is able to help her family.  At the moment, she is requesting a loan so that she can restock her food pantry with vegetables, fruits, meat, canned goods, and other products.  This will enable her to continue offering a wide variety of items to her customers.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, meat, canned goods, and other products.

loans.name: Tuliya Group

texts.fr: La cliente Furaha est secrétaire adjointe du groupement d’affaire « Tuliya»,  jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 31 ans  et mère de 5 enfants qui étudient tous. La cliente est vendeuse de haricots.  Elle installe ses marchandises dans un dépôt agricole (grenier). Elle commença ses affaires avec le prêt de l’IMF Hekima, il y a plus de 3 ans.  La cliente a déjà réalisé beaucoup de micro projets pour sa famille à travers les bénéfices de ce commerce. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’accroitre son portefeuille en achetant  2 sacs de haricots. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser ses enfants et construire une jolie maison. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
This client, Furaha, is the assistant secretary of the business group "Tuliya". She is a young, experienced entrepreneur, 31 years old, and the mother of five children, who are all students. This client is a vendor of beans. She sets up her goods at a farm warehouse (barn). 

She started her business with a loan from the microfinance institution Hekima over three years ago. She has already realized many micro-projects for her family through the profits from this business. This new loan will be used to increase her inventory by purchasing 2 sacks of beans. She would thus like to educate her children and build a beautiful house. 

In conclusion, she thanks Hekima very much for its micro-credit support for small-scale entrepreneurs who are unbanked. It should be noted that some clients in the photo are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to purchase beans to sell in her food stall

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Brigid

texts.en:
Brigid, a 29-year-old married mother of two from Mwingi, earns a living for her family by operating a retail shop. She also does poultry farming to supplement her income. She has been unable to keep her shop fully stocked due to a lack of investment capital. Her business is only marginally sustainable because she is unable to expand it. Her goal is to fully stock her store in order to attract more customers and increase her profits. 

Brigid is requesting for a loan from KADET Ltd. in order to stock her shop with washing detergents, toilet rolls, rice, sugar, maize meal, cooking oil and flour. With the additional income she will earn from the business, she will improve her poultry farming and use the rest of the money to repay her loan. 

In the future, Brigid plans to purchase a PSV vehicle to venture into the transportation business and also wishes to invest in real estate business.

loans.use: to stock her shop with washing detergents, toilet rolls, rice, sugar, maize meal, cooking oil and flour

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a 40-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has three children who are attending school. She has run a Sari-sari (variety) store for 10 years now. She sells various items like canned goods, noodles, coffee, toiletries, seasoning, condiments and dry goods. She is requesting for a loan of 5000 PHP to buy soft drinks, beer and toiletries. 

She works hard so that her children can go to school; her income provides food and school fees for her children.  In the future, she dreams of seeing them successful with their studies.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, beer and toiletries

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase rice, flour, and oil to sell at his general store

loans.name: Dinara

texts.ru: Динаре 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают пятерых детей. У Динары - среднее образование, в данное время работает в детском саду поваром, в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Динара занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Динары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, 10 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Динара обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Динара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Dinara is 39 years old, married and raising five children together with her husband. Dinara has a secondary education and currently works as a cook at a kindergarten. To provide an additional source of income for her family, she is involved in animal husbandry, having started 15 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Dinara's hard work, today her business contains 2 dairy cows, 2 calves and 10 sheep. The monthly income amounts to 15,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Dinara requested a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) from the microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to buy bulls in order to increase livestock headcount. Dinara plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy bulls in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en:
Mariamu is married and has four children; two in school and two have finished school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a dried fish selling business selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of becoming a major supplier of dried fish in the near future.

With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase cooking oil and 2 sacks of dried fish.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil and 2 sacks of dried fish.

loans.name: Wasini

texts.en:
The story of Mita, daughter of Wasini:

I love Indonesian Language lessons because I feel something joyous in them. I felt little difficult to make adaptation with my new friends. But I know it’s ok. I am happy to be one of them. I have joined tae kwondo martial arts club. I usually do the exercise after school. I and my family are live together, peaceful and happy. 

I have two younger sisters who are still studying at school. We have our own unpretentious house. I am grateful for the loan given to me. With it I can continue my studies. My hometown is Tritih Wetan Village, Jeruklegi Subdistrict, Cilacap regency, Mid Java Province. The road conditions around my village are not good and much is broken. 

My father is a laborer; his salary is not fixed. It is around Rp. 500,000/month. The number of children in our family is three. They are Widiastuti (13 years old), Maelinda (7 years old), and me (15 years old). We are students. During my time in this school I have learned Accounting. The job that I wish to have is secretary/financial staff member. Something fun in this school is having new friends and new teachers.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves, 63, is married and mother to 11 children. Years ago she learned about dressmaking and she worked for several years tailoring to earn a living. But later she realized that the most profitable business was selling products already made so she changed jobs. She began buying raw materials to  cut and embroider shorts and sweatshirts, curtains and pillows, products offered in the neighborhood. She has managed to generate resources to help her husband with household expenses. 

Nieves was motivated to request a loan from GDMPC as an aid to continue with her work. She wishes to invest in the purchase of fabrics to make curtains, pillows, etc. for sale.  This way she will have the ability to guarantee better living conditions to enjoy with her family.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to make curtains, pillows, etc. for sale

loans.name: Mercedes Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña Mercedes de 58 años de edad, vive en casa propia con una hija y 3 nietos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde más de 4 años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, es una persona humilde, responsable, con muy buena moral y además muy amable  con sus clientes, sus ventas mensuales son muy buenas, gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos familiares, Doña Mercedes esta solicitando un crédito para mejorar su vivienda ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizar la construcción de un muro y cambiar el techo por esa razón esta solicitando el crédito para poder comprar ladrillos, cementos, arena, hierro, laminas y pago de mano de obra y vivir mejor y mas seguros con su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Mercedes is 58 years old.  She lives in her own home with her daughter and three grandchildren.  Mercedes has been selling clothes for more than four years and her business is located in her home.  She is a humble and responsible person with good morals.  In addition, she is very friendly with her customers.  Her monthly sales are very good.  Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to cover some of her family’s expenses.  

Doña Mercedes is requesting a home improvement loan so that she can finish the construction of a wall and replace the roof.  By requesting this loan, she will be able to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron, and roofing sheets.  She will also pay for labor.  This will allow her and her family to live better and more securely.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and pay for labor.

loans.name: Boezemwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme S.CLARISSE représente le groupe BOEZEMWENDE. M.SIDONIE se porte bien mais elle ne fait plus partie du groupe. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 07ans et le moins âgé a 14mois. 01 va à l’école. 
Mme est coiffeuse  depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Toecin. Ses clients sont les femmes, les filles de son secteur.
Elle veut s’acheter 20paquets de mèche.
Mme veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité. Elle ambitionne ouvrir un salon de coiffure.
texts.en:
Ms. S. CLARISSE represents the group BOEZEMWENDE. (M. SIDONIE is well, but is no longer part of this group.) She is a married mother of three children. The oldest is 7 years old, and the youngest is 14 months old. One goes to school.

Ms. S. CLARISSE has been a hairdresser for five years. She gets her supplies in Toecin. Her customers are women and girls in her area. She wants to purchase 20 packets of hair extensions. She wants to reinvest her profits in her business. Her ambition is to open a hairstyling salon.

loans.use: to purchase packets of hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Ismanto

texts.en:
The story of Dewi, daughter of Ismanto:

I chose accounting as a major because I think it is the most suited to me. Beside that, it is more fun if compared with others. The little hard thing for me was making an adaptation with new environment but now, I am glad because I have many new friends. Thanks to KIVA lenders, you give me a chance to carry on my studies. I hope I can reach my dream. My family is also happy because of you. 

My hometown is Brebeg village, Jeruklegi subdistrict, Cilacap Regency, Mid Java Province, Indonesia. The roads around my village are bad, many holes, muddy and rocky. It’s difficult to use them.
