My father is a simple laborer. His salary is very low and not sufficient to fulfill our needs. He earns around Rp.350,000. The number of children in our family is seven. Their ages are : 30, 28, 19, 15 years old (me), 10  and 8 years old.  The children who are still at school are Sulastri (10), Mery Analisa (19), Hesti Anggraeni (8), and me.

This loan can improve my life and family. It can help me to continue my studies until the end of my time in school. I will learn accounting because I want to be a good and professional accountant.

loans.use: To pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Mbery

texts.fr:
Mbery est une vieille dame qui s’est très tôt responsabilisée car cela fait maintenant 30 ans qu’elle est entrée dans le commerce de poissons secs. Elle est mariée et prend en charges ses 6 enfants dont l’ainé a 30 ans et le dernier, 17 ans. Elle commence sa journée à 6h et ne rentre à la maison qu'à 18h du soir.
Avec le crédit, elle va acheter des poissons secs qu'elle revend au marché de la commune de sa ville comme on le voit sur la photo. A l'avenir Mbéry souhaite  acheter une voiture pour le transport de sa marchandise ainsi elle pourra augmenter son revenu et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mbery is an elderly woman who had to be responsible early on, since it has been thirty years that she has been doing commerce in dried fish. She is married and takes care of her six children, of whom the oldest is 30, and the youngest is 17. She starts her day at 6 AM, and she does not return home until 6 PM.  

With this loan, she is going to purchase dried fish, which she resells at the communal market in her town, as can be seen in the photo. For the future, Mbery would like to purchase a car to transport her merchandise, thus she will be able to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish to resell

loans.name: Dúo San Jose De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
DUO SAN JOSE DE SAN BARTOLO
Este dúo está conformado por doña Nora Lizeth ella tiene 36 años de edad, y se dedica a la venta de productos de desechable, tienda de abarrotes, tortillería, y bolsas plásticas en el municipio de San Bartolomé, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión en la compra de mercaderia para la venta de churrasco, platillos típicos, producto desechable y aguas gaciosas ya que se aserca la feria de San Bartolome y es cuando mas se vende su deseo es que Fape / Kiva la apoye y lograr crecer  más su negocio.
texts.en:
San Jose de San Bartolo Group

This group includes Doña Nora Lizeth.  She is 36 years old and sells disposable products, groceries, tortillas, and plastic bags from her store in the town of San Bartolomé.  Nora is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of merchandise.  She plans to sell steak, traditional dishes, disposable products, and carbonated water since the San Bartolomé fair is approaching.  This event is a time when she sells more.  She hopes that FAPE and Kiva will assist her so that she can grow her business even more.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and ingredients for selling traditional dishes from her store.

loans.name: Samandar

texts.en:
Samandar  is 33 years old. He is married and has three children. He is a market vendor and sells different types of food items. The most popular items he sells include candies, sausages, macaroni, tinned food and juices.  Samandar   has seven years of experience selling food items and, during this time, he has acquired the necessary skills required to be successful. His monthly income is 200 AZN. His brother helps him to sell in the shop.

Samandar   would like to diversify his product offering and purchase more merchandise. This will help him increase sales and improve his family’s living conditions. In order to do this, he needs additional capital and he has applied for a loan of 1800 AZN. This will be   Samandar's  sixth  loan and he has a perfect credit history

loans.use: to diversify his product offering and purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Malgré son âge, madame Aminata s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 10 ans. Elle est âgée de 49 ans. Son activité consiste à vendre des produits cosmétiques. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle est à son premier prêt car vu la conjoncture actuel les denrées alimentaires deviennent de plus en plus chères. C’ est pourquoi elle sollicite l’appui financier de la caisse pour faire sa commande . Elle va aussi acheter des tissus et prêt à porter pour augmenter son stock de marchandises. Aminata aide son mari dans la gestion des charges familiales, elle commence sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 21h malgré son age. Elle travaille parce qu’elle aime cela et quelle veut améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. A l'avenir elle souhaite construire sa maison.
texts.en: Despite her age, Ms. Aminata has been active in commerce for over ten years. She is 49 years old. Her business involves selling cosmetic products. She is a married mother of a family. She is on her first loan, since supplies at this time are becoming more and more expensive. This is why she is requesting financial support from the branch office to order supplies. She is also going to purchase some fabrics and ready-to-wear clothing to increase her stock of merchandise. Aminata helps her husband to manage family expenses. Her day starts at 8 AM and finishes at 9 PM in spite of her age. She works because she loves to and because she wants to improve her family's living conditions. For the future, she would like to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products to sell at the market

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip, a 38-year-old married father of seven from Mwingi. He supports his family by operating a retail shop. His biggest challenge is insufficient income to keep the store well stocked. Because of this, he has been unable to attract more customers and expand the business. He needs to make his shop more profitable so he can improve the living conditions for his family. 

He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family. A loan from KADET Ltd. will allow Philip to purchase maize flour, toilet rolls, rice, cooking oil, salt and sugar for his store. With the additional income he will earn from the sale of these products, he plans to reinvest in the business. He wants to be able to continue to support the education of his seven children through college. 

In the future, he hopes to purchase a piece of land to construct a residential house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, toilet rolls, rice, cooking oil, salt and sugar.

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
Mabel tiene 27 años, es de la ciudad de Caaguazú. Ella empezó con este trabajo hace 2 años, aproximadamente desde el año: 2.011, Empezó con el capital que sus padres y hermanos le dieron,  para invertir en compras de ropas y bijouterie, en un local alquilado y estratégicamente ubicado, donde la zona es bastante transitada, en la actualidad ya tiene su clientela,  gracias a la cordialidad con la que atiende a su clientela. Ella comenta que seguirá poniendo todo su esfuerzo y sacrificio para que su negocio cada día sea más grande.
Este crédito le servirá para comprar más jeans, camisas, remeras, etc. esta compra le ayudara a aumentar sus venta.
texts.en:
Mabel, age 27, is from the city of Caaguazú.  She started working in 2011, approximately two years ago.  With the capital that her parents and siblings gave her, Mabel invested the money in the purchase of clothing and jewelry.  She has a rented shop that is strategically located in a very busy area.  Mabel already has customers and attends to them in a friendly manner.  She says that she will continue to put forth all of her effort and make sacrifices each day so that her business will get bigger.  

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more jeans, shirts, T-shirts, and other items.  This will help to increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy more jeans, shirts, T-shirts, and other items.

loans.name: Aivaz

texts.en:
Aivaz is a 52-year-old, married man. He lives in Bolnisi district with his wife and son. He has been involved in the agricultural business from early childhood since his parents were farmers and this is a traditional activity for the family. 

Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Aivaz was unable to start a professional career. Aivaz works hard on family-owned, agricultural land, growing maize, haricots, and potatoes. He always has high-quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price.  

Since the family only has seasonal income, Aivaz decided to open a grocery store and seek credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 

A start-up program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Aivaz's application was approved under the framework of this program, allowing him to receive a loan of GEL 2,000. 

With the received credit, he will renovate a space located near his house and purchase a stock of groceries. Aivaz thinks that the business will be profitable since it is in a great location and is the only business of this kind in the area. 

After the general store is opened, the family will have a stable income, which will enable them to cover everyday costs and expand the business in the future. With the support of the start-up program, Aivaz will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle the financial difficulties.

loans.use: to open a grocery store.

loans.name: Qandifa

texts.en:
Qandifa is a 57-year-old woman and a widow who raises her two children alone. She is a market vendor and sells different kind of goods like shampoos, flour, beverages, macaroni, butter, and candies. She has 16 years of experience and has a deep knowledge of the market and the demands of her clients. Since her husband’s death, she has received social financial support, but it is too low to cover her family's demands.

The food products Qandifa sells are very popular among people and in high demand. Her monthly profit from selling foods is 200 AZN. Her sons help in purchasing products and bringing them to the shop. This is the sole financial income for her family. She is a very successful entrepreneur because of her good location in the central bazaar of her home city.

She applied for a loan of 1,800 AZN to purchase more food products and diversify the range of goods to cover her customers` demands.

loans.use: to purchase more food products and diversify the range of goods to cover her customers` demands.

loans.name: Reebok Group

texts.en:
Kimwisho, who is in her mid-20s, is a single mother of two children, both of whom are in school. For two years now Kimwisho has been running a cafe where she sells items including sodas, juice, milk, biscuits, cakes, mandazi and water. Working from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. daily, she is able to make a small monthly profit.


This will be Kimwisho's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, her previous ones having been used to start selling cakes, biscuits, mandazi, etc. and to restock drinks.  She has since repaid the loans and used her profits to buy a wadrobe, radio, TV set and food and to pay for household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more stocks of sodas, juice, milk, biscuits, cakes, mandazi and water.  She dreams of becoming a famous business woman.


Kimwisho will share this loan with her 10-member group "Reebok," who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of sodas, juice, milk, biscuits, cakes, mandazi and water.

loans.name: G.s El Chorro Group

texts.es:
La  joven Luz  es una persona honesta y  responsable vive con  su madre  y sus 2 hijos en un municipio de Choluteca en la zona  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  una pulpería.
Doña Luz  el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de refrescos, azúcar, mantaca, huevos,  leña, maíz, café, arroz, leche, galletas, etc. Con el préstamo el espera  el aumento de las ventas gracias a que contara con más  mercadería  en  esta  temporada  de fiestas patrias. 
Doña Luz al igual que sus compañeras de grupo desea  que con esta inversión mejore  su situación  económica y  se vea reflejado  con este préstamo. En unos años espera que  su negocio este posicionado como  un mini súper y sea  reconocido en su  caserío.
Doña Luz  su sueño es poder seguir apoyando a  sus hijos  a que se conviertan en persona de bien para la  sociedad.
Doña Noris su negocio es la pulpería  desde hace 2 años en la misma comunidad 
Doña Dilenia su negocio  es la  compra y venta  de  gallinas   desde hace 6  años.
Doña Dilma su negocio  es la  compra y venta  de  gallinas   desde hace 6  años.
Doña Juana María su negocio  es la  compra y venta  de  gallinas   desde hace 3  años.

Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto  del   2013
texts.en:
Luz  is a young, honest and responsible person who lives with her mother and her two children in the municipality of Choluteca in the south of Honduras. She runs a small store. Luz needs the loan to buy soft drinks, sugar, lard, eggs, wood, corn, coffee, rice, milk, cookies etc. With this loan she hopes to increase her sales thanks to being better stocked. This is the season of national festivals.

Luz, the same as the other members of the group, would like this investment to improve her economic situation and taking out a loan reflects this desire. In a few years time she hopes her store will be stocked like a mini-supermarket and be well known in her area. Her dream is to be able to continue to support her children. She hopes they will grow up to be good citizens.

Norys has had a small store in the same community for the last two years. Dilenia has bought and sold chickens for the past six years. Dilma has also sold chickens for 6 years. Juana María has bought and sold chickens for 3 years.



Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto  del   2013

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, sugar, lard, eggs, wood, corn, coffee, rice, milk, cookies etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lecy

texts.es: Lecy, de 42 años, es una mujer alegre y trabajadora es una madre soltera, tiene 04 hijos de 20, 19, 12 y 08 años de edad, vive en su casa propia. EL trabajo de Lecy consiste en la venta de comida por las noches,  pero desde muy temprano sale al mercado en busca de los pollos y verduras mas frescas, de ahi va a su casa y arregla algunas cosas para dejar preparando todo y salir por las noches a la vereda de su casa a vender sus comidas; tiene un carrito en donde prepara estos productos, lleva realizando este trabajo ya por cuatro años y lo hace sola. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le da tiempo de poder realizar las labores de su hogar y no descuidar a sus pequeños hijos quienes aun necesitan mucho de su cuidado, le esta yendo bien ya que gana casi el doble de su inversión, le gustaría mas adelante tener una tienda de productos y poder generar mayores ingresos desde su hogar. Por tanto éste es su segundo crédito con Kiva, le esta yendo bien y espera poder seguir así. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 soles, comprará mesas, sillas, y algunos insumos e ingredientes tales como plátano, harina, arroz, etc., para seguir con su trabajo de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Lecy is 42 years old and is a happy and hard-working woman. She is a single mother, with 4 children aged 20, 19, 12 and 8 and she lives in her own house. 

Lecy's job is selling food at night time, but early in the morning she goes to the market to buy chicken and the freshest vegetables. She then goes back to her house and gets organised so that she has everything prepared, then goes out to the pavement outside her house at night to sell her food. She has a little cart where she prepares the food. 

She has been doing this for 4 years now and she works on her own. What she likes about the work is that it gives her time to carry out her household tasks and she is able to care for her younger children who still need a lot of looking after. The business is going well and she is making almost double her investment. In the future she would like to have a shop selling products and be able to make more income from home. 

Therefore this is Lecy's second loan with Kiva; it is going well for her and she hopes it will stay that way. She will use the 1000 soles requested to buy tables, chairs and some supplies and ingredients such as plantains, flour, rice, etc. in order to continue with her work selling food.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs as well as ingredients for her food.

loans.name: Ma. Junosie

texts.en:
Ma. Junosie runs a sari-sari, or convenience, store in Talibon, Bohol. She is forty-eight years old, married, and has four children between the ages of eleven and twenty-seven. Ma. Junosie works hard to save for her children's education. Her husband works as a farmer. 

Ma. Junosie started her sari-sari store eighteen years ago. She sells various items including coffee, sugar, canned goods, and toiletries. Ma. Junosie is requesting a loan to buy more merchandise for her store, including soft drinks, rice, canned goods, shampoo, coffee, and seasoning. The loan will help increase her sales and business profitability.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, rice, canned goods, shampoo, coffee and seasoning

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish and seafood at wholesale.

loans.name: Dorita

texts.es: Doña dorita  vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica  a la venta de mariscos  en el mercado municipal, es una persona  muy reconocida por tal razón tiene una gran clientela  fija , la cliente es una persona  amable  y muy responsable, es de esta manera  con la cual ella logra  subsistir y solventar algunos de los gastos de la casa,  es por ello que está solicitando un crédito con el cual  tiene pensando  invertirlo en mas compra de mariscos por mayor  y así incrementar sus ingresos y mejor su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Dorita lives in a house of her own with her four children.  She works selling seafood in the municipal market.  She’s a very well-known person so she has a large, regular clientele.  She’s a kind, very responsible person.  She’s able to subsist and cover some of her household expenses this way.  She’s asking for a loan to buy more seafood at wholesale to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seafood at wholesale.

loans.name: Madeline

texts.en:
Madeline is 48 years old, married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Madeline has a butcher shop business in the Philippines. Madeline requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more livestock to sell in her food stall.

Madeline has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Madeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to butcher and sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ekaterine

texts.en:
Ekaterine is 41 years old. She lives in the village of Ruispiri, with her retired parents and husband. Ekaterine is a hair stylist. She works from her house and earns a small monthly income. Besides her main job, she helps her family members run an agricultural business. Specifically, they own a vineyard and produce wine with the harvested grapes. The wine is sold at the local open market. Ekaterine has one pig as well, and sells piglets seasonally. 

The family's existing income is too small to cover daily expenses. That is why Ekaterine has decided to purchase a car so that her husband can work as a taxi driver. Ekaterine’s husband is jobless and was unable to find an appropriate job because there is a high unemployment rate in the region. With the credit received, Ekaterine will purchase a car, and it will be used as a taxi. Her husband will work as a driver to increase the family's income. Local people often use taxi services because the minibus line works hourly and they have to wait for transportation for a long time. The new business initiative, financed with this Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car for her husband to start a taxi business

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es: Don Feliciano de 45 años de edad vive  con su familia en casa  propia,  tiene 25 años de poseer una tienda en su lugar de residencia,  es muy  reconocido en la zona por su amabilidad con los clientes, honesto, responsable  y muy trabajador  por eso posee mucha clientela, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Feliciano está solicitando un crédito para poder  realizar la compra de mas productos como: granos básicos, sopas, huevos, golosinas, refrescos, etc. para surtir mas la tienda y generar más ingresos y alcanzar una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Feliciano, 45, lives in a house of his own with his family.  He’s owned a home-based store for 25 years.  He’s very well-known in the zone for his kindness towards customers; he’s honest, responsible and very hard working which is why he has a large clientele.  He uses what he earns to cover some of his household expenses.  

Feliciano’s asking for a loan to be able to buy more merchandise like basic grains, soups, eggs, snacks, soft-drinks, etc. to better stock the store and to generate more income and reach improved economic stability.

loans.use: to buy more stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Flerida Lucia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Flerida, tiene 38 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 10 y 7 años de edad, ambos estudian en escuela. Su esposo es militar. 

Doña Flerida se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza  en su casa donde tiene un pequeño local con vitrinas donde muestra su mercadería, ella sale a recorrer cuatro días por semana más que todo en las mañanas y en su casa vende todos los días, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil y también viaja hasta Ipiales (Colombia) y Huaquillas (Perú) cuando necesita mercadería, lleva en su negocio  16 años  y sus ganancias las utiliza para la educación de sus hijos que son lo más importante.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio hace 15 años   y le gusta porque con los créditos ella sale adelante. 

Sus sueños es tener un almacén y darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Al Progreso” (To Progress) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts which are well-known both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

Flerida, 38, lives here.  She’s married and has two children who are 10 and 7 years of age; both attend school.  Her husband’s in the military.

Flerida works selling all types of clothes door to door although most of the sales take place at home where she has a small locale with display cases to show her merchandise.  She heads out to sell four days a week mostly in the morning and sells at home every day.  She sells on credit and collects every fifteen days.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy her merchandise and sometimes travels all the way to Ipiales (Colombia) and Huaquillas (Perú) when she needs merchandise.  She’s been in business 16 years and uses profits to educate her children who are most important.

She’s going to use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and children’s clothes.  She’s been in the communal bank since its beginning fifteen years ago and she likes it because she gets ahead thanks to the loans.  Her dream is to have a store and to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mulongo

texts.en:
Mulongo is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality as her major challenge. Mulongo dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, rice, beans, and cooking oil to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Sarita is 38 years-old, married and has two children ages 20 and 13. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Sarita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 
In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery stores, called pasals, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and by purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 square feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her business

loans.name: Eang

texts.en:
Eang is a 38-year-old married woman and a loving mother of two unmarried children. She has a small plantation in Pursat province and grows rice alongside her husband to earn a living. Her parents have transferred this business to her and she has been doing it for years. Their main source of income utterly relies on agriculture.

Eang would like to improve her living standard by having clean energy for household use. Because of the lack of capital, she is asking for a loan in the sum of USD 1,000 to build a biogas digester, under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnering with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, she hopes that she won’t spend much money on fuel and lessen the smoke from wood or charcoal. She is very happy and thankful, because with this loan purpose, HKL has provided her a special interest rate than its general loan. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza, de 37 años de edad, está casada con Félix y es padre de sus 05 hijos. Vive en compañía de su familia en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Maritza es la venta de plátanos para lo cual a acondicionado una mesa en el frontis de su casa y atiende a sus clientes de manera amable y cordial llegando a ganarse sus amistad. Lleva dedicándose a ésta actividad hace más de 03  años, con un préstamo de MFP y contando con la ayuda de sus hijos en la compra del producto y la atención de los clientes, en sus ratos libres. Espera poder mantener su negocio y seguir contando con su sustento diario, ya que por su edad no podrá conseguir empleo. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva y se siente contenta y agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de 600 nuevos soles, invertirá en la compra de plátanos buscando precios bajos por sus compras en volumen, aprovechando que éste producto está de escasez y los precios están al alza, de esa manera tendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maritza is 37 years old, married to Félix and mother to 5 children. She lives with her family in her own home. Maritza sells bananas from a table set up at the front of her house. She attends to her customers in a friendly and cordial manner, in the end winning their friendship. She has been doing this for three years. She has had one loan From MFP and can count on the help of her children in buying the product and in attending to the customers in their free time. She hopes to keep the business going and continue to count on this daily sustenance. At her age it is difficult to find a job.

This is Maritza's first loan with Kiva. She will invest the 600 PEN to buy bananas at a low price by buying in volume. Taking advantage of a shortage of the product and prices being elevated, she will generate more income.

loans.use: to buy bananas wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, eggs, drinks, sweets, soups, sugar, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta es madre soltera vive en casa de su madre con su hijo de 4 años de edad, es muy reconocida  en la zona  vende productos  varios en el mercado y de forma ambulante, tiene 4 años de experiencia en el negocio, es una persona muy trabajadora, responsable y honrada   con esto trata  de solventar sus gastos necesarios, la clienta está solicitando un crédito con el cual tiene pensado  realizar la compra de mercadería como: corta uñas, pomadas, cremas, etc.  para incrementar  los ingresos  y alcanzar una  mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This client’s a single mother living with her 4-year-old son in her mother’s house.  She’s very well-known in the zone.  She sells various products in the market and from place to place.  She has four years’ experience in the business.  She’s a very hardworking, responsible, honest person who tries to cover her household expenses this way.  She’s asking for a loan she plans to use to buy merchandise like nail clippers, pomade, cream, etc. to increase income and attain better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy nail clippers, pomade, cream, etc.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: Don Juan vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica a realizar viajes en su pick up a las diferentes colonias donde el reside, tiene mucha clientela por su amabilidad y responsabilidad a la hora de manejar, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunas gastos de su hogar, don Juan  esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de repuestos y darle mantenimiento a su vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y así obtener mejores ganancias y  podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and two children in a house of his own.  He works making trips in his pick-up truck to various neighborhoods where he lives.  He has many customers thanks to his kindness and responsible way of driving.  He uses profits earned to cover some of his household expenses.  

Juan’s asking for a loan to buy spare parts and to service his vehicle since it’s his only source of income so that he can earn higher profits and be able to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Canaana Group

texts.en:
Elodi is a young 26-year-old entrepreneur and a mother of 4 children who are all students. She is a member of the “Canaana” business group. She is an owner of a restaurant. She opened it with her own funds, given to her by her husband. She started this activity 5 years ago. 

This new loan will allow Elodi to buy 3 sacks of potatoes, 40 liters of vegetable oil, 50 kgs of rice, fishes, meat, and yoghurt.  In the future she wishes to increase her portfolio, to pay for school fees and to take care of her children. She addresses her gratitude to Hekima for the financial support towards women who have no access to bank services.

loans.use: buy food ingredients for her restaurant

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Genesis

texts.en: Genesis had enrolled his last year in college studying education at Western Mindanao State university. He is applying for a student loan from GDMPC  to be able to cover tuition fees. He have a keen interest in studying education because of his passion for teaching. It is his desire to finish his courses and his dream is almost becoming true.

loans.use: cover tuition fees

loans.name: Merab

texts.en:
Merab is a 38-year-old married man.  He lives in Batumi district with his wife, mother and 3 children. His mother works as a nurse at a local hospital and gets small monthly income. Merab works at a local bakery as a baker. 

As the income is not enough to cover everyday costs, Merab decided to open his own bakery and sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 

This Start Up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Merab's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $1800.  With the received credit, Merab will renovate the space near his house and will purchase the raw materials and all the necessary things for opening a bakery. 

Merab thinks that the business will be profitable, as he is very experienced in this field and also it is in a great location and is the only business of this kind in the area. After the bakery is opened, the family will have a stable income, which will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in the future.  With support of the Start Up program Merab will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and deal with the financial difficulties.

loans.use: open a bakery

loans.name: Berthe

texts.en:
Berthe is a single Cameroonian woman aged forty-six with two children. The older child is twenty and is in high school, while the younger one is sixteen and in secondary school. 

Berthe has been in her fruit and vegetable business for the past fifteen years, which makes her very experienced and stable. Her business is successful because it is located in an urban area where the demand is high. She is likely to succeed because of her very long experience in the business and her numerous supply contracts she has been having over time. The previous loan greatly help her and this loan will help her increase her turn over from 2100 000 Frs. to 2300000 Frs. monthly and increase her profit by 21 percent as well as improving her standard of living

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Idalia Luisa

texts.es:
Idalia es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde hace 8 años inicio su negocio de venta de productos de belleza y venta de bebidas gaseosas y cervezas,asi como tambien vende dulces como gelatinas, chupetes, entre otros; con los ingresos de su humilde trabajo puede solventar con mucho esfuerzo los gastos de su hogar, es por ello que cada día se esfuerza mucho para poder salir adelante.

Idalia está muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio y también adquirir un pequeño terreno, de esta manera podrá mejorar sus ingresos y poder tener un terreno para seguir luchando por el bienestar de su familia y cumplir su gran sueño de la casa propia.
texts.en:
Idalia’s a very hardworking woman. She started a business selling beauty products, soft-drinks and beer as well as candy, gelatin, popsicles, etc. 8 years ago.  With income from her humble work she’s able with much effort to cover her household expenses.  This is why she strives hard every day to be able to get ahead.

Idalia’s very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support they’ve provided her she will be able to buy merchandise for her business and also to buy a small piece of land.  In this way she’ll be able to improve her income and will be able to own land to continue striving for her family’s well-being and reach her great dream of owning a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and to buy a piece of land.

loans.name: Patricia Jakeline

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

Aquí vive la señora Patricia, tiene 35 años  de edad, es madre soltera de  dos hijos de 8 y 6  años que estudian en escuela. Vive en casa de sus padres. 

Doña Patricia para ganarse el sustento diario y para que a sus pequeños hijos no les falte nada hace más de 10 años adecuo una pequeña tienda en la casa de sus padres, la misma que es  en sociedad con su mamá y que le permite salir adelante, gracias a los créditos han ido aumentando su negocio y con el pasar del  tiempo además de vender productos de primera necesidad también vende artículos de bazar, útiles escolares y ciertas medicinas, trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano y lo hace por el bienestar de sus hijos.

Con este crédito va a comprar útiles escolares, productos de primera necesidad y medicinas. Lleva en el Banco Comunal más de 8 años  y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Su sueño es darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Al Progreso” (To Progress) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are renown nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

Patricia, 35, lives here.  She’s a single mother of two children who are 8 and 6 years old and attending school.  She lies in her parents’ house.

To earn her daily sustenance and so that her little ones will lack nothing, Patricia opened a small store in her parents’ house more than ten years ago.  She’s in partnership with her mother and it makes it possible for her to get ahead.  Thanks to the loans, business has been growing and as time has passed in addition to selling basic staples she’s added household items, school supplies and certain medicines.  She works every day from very early on and she does so for her children’s well-being.

She will use this loan to buy school supplies, basic staple items and medicines.  She’s been in the communal bank for more than 8 years and she likes it because of the help the loans provide.  Her dream is to give her children the best.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, basic staples and medicines.

loans.name: Tiep's Group

texts.en:
Tiep was born in 1981.  She has three children who are learning in 8th grade, 4th grade and in kindergarten.  Her husband is a sewing machine repairer to earn a living.  He earns about 4,500,000 VND per month.  Tiep is a tailor, and she earns about 5,000,000 VND per month.  She has done this job for ten years.  Her family’s total earnings are about 9,500,000 VND per month.  Her challenges in life and work are lack of capital to buy more materials for her sewing and lack of money to pay her children’s education fees.  Her dream is to expand her sewing store.  She has a passion for this job because it’s a free job and she can work at her home.  This loan is one step toward helping her get to this dream.  

Tiep is a hardworking and careful woman.  She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2010.  In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,184,000 VND and repaid on time.  In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy more materials for her sewing store.  She always wants to expand her sewing store to gain earnings and save profits for her children to grow up well.

Other members who are part of Tiep's group include the following: Hanh is 34 years old. She has two children. She sells telephones. She wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to invest in her business. Hong is 33 years old. She has two children. She is a barber. She wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to invest in her business. Thao is 26 years old. She has two children. She is a dentures manufacturer. She wants to borrow 9,184,000 VND to invest in her business. Hang is 41 years old. She has two children. She sells beverages. She wants to borrow 6,944,000 VND to invest in her business. Hang is 36 years old. She has four children. She sells food. She wants to borrow 9,184,000 VND to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her sewing store.

loans.name: Hoa's Group

texts.en:
Hoa was born in 1969 and has three children. The oldest is currently in college and the others are learning at the 8th and 2nd grade. Hoa’s husband is a solder worker and he earns about 4,000,000 VND per month. Hoa breeds pigs to earn a living. Her income is about 2,500,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 20 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,500,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work are a lack of capital to breed more pigs. Her dream is for a better life for her family, for her children to be successful in life and for her breeding scale to be expanded. This loan is one of the steps to help her reach this dream. 

Hoa is a hardworking and dynamic woman who has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2008. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,528,000 VND to buy more pigs and to expand her breeding scale. 

Other members who are part of Hoa's group are:

Cham is 39 years old and has two children. She sells pork and wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to breed a fish pond.
 
Giang is 38 years old and has three children. She raises chickens and wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to breed chickens and pigs.

Hang is 37 years old and has two children. She sells vegetables in the market and wants to borrow 7,392,000 VND to invest in her business. 

Giang is 29 years old and has two children. He makes aluminum frames and wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to invest in his business.

Van is 24 years old and does not yet have children. She breeds chickens and wants to borrow 6,496,000 VND to buy food for the chickens.

loans.use: to buy more pigs and to expand her breeding scale.

loans.name: Chien's Group

texts.en:
Chien was born in 1970. She has three children. One of her daughters works. Another child attends college and the other is in 4th grade. Chien’s husband is a construction worker. His income is about 4,000,000 VND per month. Chien sells agricultural materials and she earns about 3,500,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 15 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 7,500,000 VND per month. Her challenge in life and work is the lack of capital to buy more agricultural material for her store. Her dream is to have more capital to expand her store. This loan is one step to help her reach this dream. Chien is a hardworking and dynamic woman.

She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2008. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 9,632,000 VND and repaid on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,976,000 VND to buy more agricultural material for her store. She always wants to expand her business.

Other members which are part of Chien's group include the following:
 
Lan is 56 years old. She has three children. She breeds chickens. She wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to invest in her breeding business. 
 
Thuong is 43 years old. She has two children. She sells scrap. She wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to invest in her business. 
 
Oanh is 38 years old. He has a child. He sells fruits. He wants to borrow 10,528,000 VND to invest in his business. 
 
Ha is 40 years old. She has two children. She mills rice to earn a living. She wants to borrow 7,392,000VND to invest in her work.

loans.use: to buy more agricultural material for her store.

loans.name: Thinh's Group

texts.en:
Thinh was born in 1983. She has three daughters who are in school in the second grade and kindergarten. Her husband works in electronic repair. He earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. Thinh sells eggs in the market to earn a living and her income is 3,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for five years. Her family’s total income is about 8,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in work is lack of capital to invest in her business. Her dream is having more capital to open a store. This loan is one step to help her reach her dream. Thinh is a hardworking woman and a passionate businessperson.
She has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program since 2006. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 5,014,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 6,322,000 VND to buy more eggs to sell. She always wants to expand her business.

Other members who are part of Thinh’s group include the following :

 Soa is 50 years old. She has two children. She grows rice. She wants to borrow 9,374,000 VND to do carpentry.
 Ngo is 35 years old. She has two children. She grows rice. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed chickens.
 Yen is 26 years old. She has three children. She sells charcoal.  She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell in the market.

loans.name: Sonia Tamara

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Sonia, tiene 40 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 16 y 14 años que estudian en colegio.  El marido trabaja con ella.

Doña Sonia junto a su querido esposo tienen un restaurante en su casa,  allí  todas las tardes se encargan de preparar meriendas, las mismas que son el deleite de sus clientes, todos los días prepara diferentes platos para satisfacción de sus clientes que día a día aumentan. Llevan más de 12 años que se dedican a esta actividad la misma que les permite salir adelante honradamente y así mismo estar al tanto de las necesidades de sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos. Lleva 7 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque en el banco ha hecho muy buenas amigas. 

Su sueño es darles una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The “Al Progreso” (To Progress) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are renown nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

Sonia, 40, lives here. She’s in a common law relationship and has two children who are 16 and 14 years of age and attending school.  Her husband works with her.

Sonia and her husband have a home-based restaurant.  They prepare dinner there every evening for their customers to enjoy.  She prepares different dishes every day to satisfy her customers who increase every day.  They’ve been in this same business more than 12 years and it makes it possible for them to get ahead honorably while at the same time take care of their children’s needs.

She will use the loan to buy foodstuffs to prepare her dishes.  She’s been in the communal bank 7 years and likes it because she’s made many friendships in the bank.  Her dream is to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Karen Sofia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señorita Karen, tiene 24 años  de edad, está  soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, ella está por terminar su carrera de  Lic. En Comunicación en una Universidad de Manta.

Además de dedicarse a sus estudios también dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y bisutería de la marca Vizzón, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en la universidad donde estudia a sus compañeras de clases y conocidos, también aprovecha todos sus ratos libres para realizar sus ventas. Deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la recibe en su casa ya que una señora le entrega allí. Tiene 5  años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante sus estudios.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y bisutería. Lleva en el Banco Comunal 5 años y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ha podido emprender un negocio que le da para solventar los gastos de sus estudios. 

Su sueño es ser una profesional.
texts.en:
The “Al Progreso” (To Progress) communal bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi Canton known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are renown nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

Karen, 24, lives here.  She’s single living in her parents’ house and about to finish her career in Communications at a university in Manta.  In addition to her studies, she also sells all types of cloths and costume jewelry of the Vizzón brand.  She sells door to door and also at the university where she’s attending classes.  She sells to her classmates and acquaintances and also takes advantage of her free time to sell.  She sells on credit and collects every fifteen days.  She receives her merchandise at home from a woman who delivers it to her there.  She’s been in this activity for five years and is able to pay for her studies that way.

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise like pants, blouses, t-shirts and costume jewelry.  She’s been in the communal bank for 5 years and likes it because thanks to the loans she’s has been able to open a business that provides her with income to pay for her schooling.  Her dream is to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy clothes and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Buenas Vecinas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BUENAS VECINAS”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Regina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tejido de mantas, tienda de abarrotes, trenzado de mantas de ceda, tejido de mantas de vicuña.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Regina es integrante, ella indica que es el segundo año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la promoción que realizó la institución en su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanía en tejido de chompas; este negocio lo empezó hace ocho años atrás al trabajar con una exportadora, posteriormente se independizó e instaló su propio taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las. Capacitaciones en salud y crédito
texts.en:
The “Buenas Vecinas” (Good Neighbors) communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Focal Center.  It consists of nine members led by a governing board presided over by Regina.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: blanket weaving, grocery store, silk blanket weaving and vicuña blanket weaving.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Regina.  She indicates that this is her second year with Pro Mujer having joined thanks to a promotional invitation that the institution gave in her zone.  She currently has a crafts business knitting sweaters that she started 8 years ago while working with an exporter.  She subsequently became independent and set up her own workshop.

The loan she’ll take out is to increase capital.  She’ll buy wool from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and after making them will sell them to order.  This way of working allows her to support her family since she’s married with two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers the health training and the credit.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Mercedes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MERCEDES” iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: trenzado de mantas, taller de costura, ganado, costura de deportivos, voceadora.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; este negocio lo emprendió al llegar de Argentina donde estaba trabajando en un taller de costuras, es por ello que decide emprender un negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de máquina de costura) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The “Mercedes” communal bank will start its 8th cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Cascada Focal Center.  It consists of 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Rosa.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: blanket weaving, sewing workshop, cattle, sportswear manufacturing and newspaper sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Rosa.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for a year having joined thanks to an invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a sewing workshop that she started when she returned from Argentina where she’d been working in a sewing workshop and then decided to start her own business.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy a sewing machine from wholesalers in the city of El Alto and then make items to sell to order.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family since she’s in a common law relationship and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers the health services.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Sinh's Group

texts.en:
Sinh is 33 years old. She has four children. Three of them are learning at the secondary school and primary school. The last child is young. 

To earn a living, Sinh and her husband cook food to sell. Besides that, they breed chickens and pigs. Her husband’s income is about VND 4,000,000 and Sinh earns about VND 6,000,000 per month. They have done this job for two years. Her family’s total earnings are about VND 10,000,000 per month. 

Sinh's challenge in life and work is a lack of capital to invest in her food-selling and her children are still young. Her dream is to breed chickens in larger numbers. This loan is one of the steps that helps Sinh reach this dream. She can buy more chickens and pigs to raise. 

Sinh is a hard-working woman and a passionate businesswoman. She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed VND 5,152,000 and repaid the loan on time. 

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy more chickens to expand her poultry-breeding activities. She also wants to help her children grow up well.

Other members that are part of Sinh's Group include the following:

Ha is 33 years old. She has two children. She sells popcorn. She wants to borrow VND 9,632,000 to invest in her selling. 

Yen is 20 years old. She has two children. She sells beverages. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to invest in her selling.

Huyen is 46 years old. She has three children. She cooks food to sell. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to buy more ingredients for her cooking.

Luong is 18 years old. She has a child. She is a worker. She wants to borrow VND 5,152,000 to breed chickens.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to expand her poultry-breeding activities.

loans.name: Hiep

texts.en:
Hiep was born in 1959. She has two children who have their own families. One makes aluminum frames and the other is a medical staff member in a ward. Hiep’s husband is a staff member in a ward and his income is about 3,000,000 VND per month. Hiep breeds chicken to earn a living. She earns about 2,500,000 VND per month. Hiep has done this job for 25 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,500,000 VND per month. 

Hiep's challenge in life and work is the lack of capital to buy more chickens for her farm. Her dream is to have a more spacious house and to expand the scale of her breeding business. This loan is one of the steps that will help her reach this dream. She can invest it in her breeding business to gain earnings and save profit for her family’s life. 

Hiep is a hardworking woman and is passionate about business. She has participated in SEDA's microfinance program since 2012. In the last loan cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid on time. In this new loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,496,000 VND to buy more chickens to expand the scale of her breeding business.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for breeding.

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS ANGELES”  iniciará el sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Juana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: chiflería (comercio de accesorios para saumerío), tejido de prendas, venta de ropa americana, repostería, tejido de chompas, tienda de barrio, venta de pantalones.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Juana es integrante, ella indica que hace seis meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; este negocio lo emprendió con un pequeño ahorro que cuando le ayudaba a su madre, posteriormente decide implementar su negocio independiente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el consultorio de médico.
texts.en:
The “Los Angeles” (The Angels) communal bank will start its sixth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Juana.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: “chiflería” (selling accessories to make incense or aromatic smoke), clothes making, sales of American clothes, pastry making, sweater knitting, neighborhood store and pants sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Juana.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for six months having joined thanks to an invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.  She currently has a business weaving and selling blankets.  She started it with some small savings she earned while helping her mother.  Later on, she decided to open her own business.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy wool from street markets in the city of El Alto and then after she makes them will sell them in her stand.  This way of working allows her to earn income to support her home as best possible since she’s in a common law relationship and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers the medical clinic.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Sartasiñani Kullacanacas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SARTASIÑANI KULLACANACAS”  iniciará el trigésimo segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Celia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de CD’s, venta de lentes, venta de ropa, venta de peluches, venta de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Celia es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de la asesora que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de lentes y gafas; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace quince años atrás, con al observar el consumo que tenía este productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lentes y gafas) que adquirirá de las distribuidoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que se realiza en la Banca Comunal
texts.en:
The “Sartasiñani Kullacanacas” communal bank will start its 32nd cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Celia.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: CD sales, glasses sales, clothing sale, stuffed toy sales and fruit sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Celia.  She indicates that she’s been in Pro Mujer for 8 cycles having joined thanks to an invitation from an advisor that visited her at home.  She currently has a business selling glasses and sunglasses.  She relates that she started this business 15 years ago when she noted the high consumption this product had.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy glasses and sunglasses from wholesale suppliers in the city of El Alto and then sell them in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her home as best possible since she’s married and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers the saving she earns in the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy glasses and sunglasses

loans.name: Juana Azurduy Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JUANA AZURDUY”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Julia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: Costura de overoles, venta de pantalones, tejido de mantas, costura de deportivos, tejido de mantas, venta de pescado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Julia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una asesora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de overoles; este negocio lo emprendió de su actual pareja, quien conocía la técnica de costura de este producto en la actualidad ambos abrieron un taller de costura donde comercializan sus productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “Juana Azurduy” communal bank will start the fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Focal Center.  It has 8 members led by a governing board presided over by Julia.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses among which are: overall manufacturing, pants sales, blanket weaving, sportswear manufacturing, blanket weaving and fish sales.

The loan they’ll take out will benefit small micro businesswomen like Julia.  She indicates that she’s been part of Pro Mujer for two years having joined thanks to an invitation from an institution’s advisor that visited her at home.  She currently has a business manufacturing overalls, a business she learned from her current spouse who was knowledgeable in this particular sewing skill so they decided to open a workshop together where they sell their products.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase capital.  She will buy fabric in street markets in El Alto and after making them will sell them in her sales space.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her home as possible since she’s in a common law relationship and has four children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers the health training and the credit.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Iago

texts.en:
Iago is a 48-year-old married man. He lives in the small village of Vani district with his wife, Marina. Iago has been involved in the animal husbandry business from early childhood, as his parents were farmers and this is a traditional activity for the family. Sadly, due to a lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Iago was unable to study for a professional career. Iago has a cow, a pig and two calves. Marina milks the cow every day and produces dairy products for selling. In addition, Iago works hard on the family-owned land, where he grows nut trees. He always has high-quality nuts, which he sells to local retailers for a good price. 

As the income is too small, Iago decided to start a nut-trading business and seek credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. This startup program, which is joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Iago's application was approved under the framework of this program for a loan of 2,000 GEL. With this loan he will purchase a stock of nuts and then resell them at a higher price. This will increase his income and he will be able to expand his husbandry business and generate more income. The new business initiative will give him chance to have financial stability and monthly income.

loans.use: to begin trading in nuts

loans.name: Maria Paula

texts.es: Doña Maria  de 41 años  es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, desde hace 5 años se dedica a la crianza de pollos,  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, comercializa sus pollos por encargo y en los mercados que están  cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar,  ahora ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar concentrado y vitaminas para seguir con la crianza de pollos y satisfacer la demanda de la clientela  ya establecida que posee y así generar mayores ingresos  y una calidad de vida más estable para sus hijos.
texts.en: María, 41, is a single mother living with her two children in a house of her own.  She’s been working raising chickens for the last five years.   She’s a very hardworking, responsible person.  She sells the chickens to order and in markets near her place of residence.  She uses what she earns from her sales to cover some of her household expenses.  She’s asking for a loan now to be able to buy feed concentrate and vitamins to continue raising chickens and to satisfy the demand from regular customers she already has to generate higher income that way and provide a more stable quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Hai's Group

texts.en:
Hai was born in 1965 and has two children, one of whom is a worker, the other unemployed. Hai and her husband grow rice to earn a living. Her husband earns about 2,000,000 VND and she earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 25 years. Her family’s total income is 5,000,000 VND per month. Her challenge in work is lacking capital for the business. Her dream is having more money to build a new house. This loan is one step toward helping her reach this dream. She is a hard-working woman. 
This is the first time Hai has participated in SEDA’s microfinance program. With this loan, she wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to sell natural medicine. She wants to increase earnings and save the profit to build her house.
Other members who are part of Hai’s group include the following :
 Thinh is 47 years old. She has two children. She is a seller. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to sell clothes.
 Thanh is 59 years old. She has three children. She makes brooms to sell. She wants to borrow 10,246,000 VND to invest in her business.
 Thanh is 36 years old. She has three children. She grows rice. She wants to borrow 9,374,000 VND to breed chickens.

loans.use: to sell natural medicine.

loans.name: Vien's Group

texts.en:
Vien was born in 1959. She has a child who is a barber and married. Vien and her husband sell groceries to earn a living. Her husband earns about 2,500,000 VND and Vien earns about 3,000,000 VND per month. She has done this job for 25 years. Her family’s total income is about 5,500,000 VND per month. Besides that, she also sells vegetables to earn more money. Her challenge in work is lacking capital to buy more vegetables for her store. Her dream is for her house to be more spacious and her store expanded. This loan is one step toward helping her reach her dream. Vien is a hard-working and dynamic woman.
She has participated in SEDA’s credit program since 2008. With the last loan, she borrowed 7,840,000 VND and repaid on time. In this loan, she wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to buy beer, noodles, beverages, biscuits and tobacco for her grocery store. She wants to expand her grocery store.
Other members who are part of Vien's group include the following :
Thin is 61 years old. She has three children. She sells beef in the market. She wants to borrow 10,080,000 VND to invest in her business.
Binh is 55 years old. She has three children. She sells vegetables in the market. She wants to borrow 10,080,000 VND to invest in her business.
Vien is 40 years old. She has a child. She sells scrap. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to invest in her business.
Mai is 34 years old. She has two children. She is a carpenter. She wants to borrow 5,152,000 VND to make carpentry.

loans.use: to buy beer, noodles, beverages, biscuits and tobacco for her grocery store

loans.name: Norberto

texts.en:
Norberto is married and has seven children.  He resides in Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. Norberto runs a general store to earn a living.  Aside from this, he operates a transportation service where he transports customers and packages.  He will use this 25,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts to service his motorbike. 

Norberto joined GDMPC and has successfully repaid his previous loans. In the future, Norberto wants to make improvements to his house and to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: buy spare parts for his motorbike

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is from Talibon, Bohol. She is married and has four children ages 11 to 24.  She has run a sari-sari (variety) store for five years now. She sells various items like canned goods, noodles, bread, sugar, cooking oil, and soaps. 

Victcoria requested a loan of 12000 PHP to buy rice, bread, soft drinks, milk and toiletries to sell.  The loan will be used as additional capital to increase her inventory. Any profit will be for school fees and her family's diet. 
 
In the future, Victoria hopes to live an abundant life as a result of her business.

loans.use: buy inventory for her store

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
This is Florencia, 60, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Macario, a farmer, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Florencia operates a vegetable farm. She grows vegetables and other fruits on their farm located in Cavite.  It is in the high lands where it is suited to grow vegetables and other fruits. She sells her product to market and fruit stores that she regularly supplies and to the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Florencia is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs for her business. Part of the loan will go to the maintenance of her farm. 

Florencia hopes that her business will continue to expand and dreams that her child will finish his studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy fertilizer and farm inputs

loans.name: Ameena

texts.en:
Ameena is a 50-year-old widowed mother of seven children.  They live in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Ameena is taking a loan for her son, who is a salesman by profession.  He purchases large quantities of goods from wholesalers and sells them to the retailers. In this way he earns money for his family. He provides all the inventories as per the demand of the retailers. He uses his motorbike to carry the goods and delivers the goods from one place to another.  A few days ago his motorbike collided with a car and he injured his legs.  All his inventories were  scattered on the roads and became useless. 

Physically Ameena's son is better now but does not have money to buy new inventories to sell. Therefore, Ameena requested a loan for her son so that he can repair his bike and buy new inventories to continue his business.

Ameena is very thankful to KIVA and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: buy biscuits, fruit cake, chocolate, etc. to sell

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Maria Lourdes works hard to support her family.   She has a metal shop business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. 

Maria Lourdes is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF in order to buy welding rods, steel and other raw materials for her metal shop business.

Maria Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy materials for her metal shop business

loans.name: Luz De Luna Brillante Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUZ DE LUNA BRILLANTE”  iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: trenzado y tejido de mantas, elaboración de abarcas, venta de vajillas, venta de lubricantes, elaboración de herramientas, venta de golosinas, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller electrónico; este negocio lo emprendió al apoya a su actual pareja en los contratos que él tenía, aprendiendo el oficio y para ampliar los servicios ella empieza a realizar los contratos independientes.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de herramientas) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal bank 'Luz de Luna Brillante' will begin its fifth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani regional office. It is composed of eight members and is governed by a board of directors of which Alicia is president. The businesses carried out by the members of the bank are diverse and include braiding and weaving blankets, making sandals, selling dishes, selling lubricants, making tools, selling snacks, and selling food.

The loan Alicia will take out will benefit small micro-businesses of which she is a member. She indicates that two years ago she became a member of Pro Mujer after she was invited to join by a friend who is already a member. Currently, she runs an electronics shop. She started this business to support her current partner in the contracts that he had, learning the trade. To expand her services, she began to make independent contracts.

Alicia is taking this loan out to increase capital. She will buy tools from fairs in the city of El Alto and afterwards she will sell them in her shop. This type of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as much as possible since she lives in a common-law marriage and has four children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responded that she likes the trainings on health and the loans.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Machaq Qantati Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MACHAQ QANTATI”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elisa es la Tesorera.
